loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
Luis tiene 19 años de edad, su estado civil es soltero, sin hijos a su cargo, vive en casa se sus padres en el distrito de Oyotun el la provincia de Chiclayo en la región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú, en este distrito la població se dedica a la agricultura y al comercio de animales; este lugar es una zona rural.

Luis se dedica a brindar servio de obrero – jornalero en los campos de cultivos con años de experiencia en el rubro solicita préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa el monto es de 1000 nuevos soles para la compra de herramienta de trabajo(mochila para fumigar) y dar mantenimiento al resto de ellas para mejorar su trabajo; obtener mejores ingresos y apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Luis is 19 years old, single, without children in his care, and lives in his parents' house in Oyotun district, Chiclayo province, in Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Perú.  In this district, the people work in agriculture and selling animals; it is a rural area. 

Luis works as a day laborer in the fields with years of experience in this work. He asks Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles to purchase work tools (a knapsack fumigation sprayer) and to do maintenance on the rest of his tools to improve his work and get better income and support his family.

loans.use: to invest in purchasing a knapsack fumigation sprayer and maintenance for his tools.

loans.name: Mziana

texts.en:
Mziana, who is a 59-year-old woman, lives in Tbilisi city. 

She earns a living by working as a baker at a private Georgian traditional bakery. She generates income which is divided with the owner. 

In order to make her work more profitable and increase her income, Mziana decided to request a loan. Her loan application was approved with the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, the start-up program that gives a chance for people to start or re-start their own businesses. She has already found a place for opening her own bakery and, as she has good experience in this area, hopes her business will be profitable. 

Mziana will use this mentioned loan for purchasing working materials and an oven, and she hopes she can increase turnover and improve her living conditions. This business will greatly assist Mziana, as will her own activity, and she will not have to depend on other owners. 

She will be grateful for the help you can provide and will highly appreciate it.

loans.use: To purchase working materials and an oven for her bakery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone and a solar charging set  so that she may provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Maheswari Group

texts.en:
Gulaphula is the leader of a group and lives in Naktikana Village of Saragaj, Tarbha, in the district of Subarnapur, Odisha, India. She is a married woman of 22 years. She has a small family comprising four members: her husband and two children. The member standing second from the left with a raised hand is Gulaphula. 

Like most families in the locality, she and her husband are doing an animal trading business. They purchase goats, cows, buffaloes and hens from the nearby market in bulk, and sell them to the customers on a retail basis in her locality. Her husband helps her in procuring goats, cows, buffaloes and hens from the nearby market. During lean days, her husband does labor in her locality and earns some money. 

This is the first loan she wants to take. To improve her living conditions and earn some extra income, she wants to avail a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. To avail a loan, she makes a group of 12 women of her locality. At present her monthly income is 2,700 rupees from her business and 2,300 rupees from daily labor, which comes to 5,000 rupees, which is not sufficient to lead a better life. So, she wants to take a loan to purchase a bulk quantity of animals for trading. She has a cherished dream to increase her productivity and educate her children in school.

The other 11 members are Uttam, Baidehi, Bui, Bhagabati, Ahalya, Rebati, Kousalya, Gyatri, Tapisa, Upasi and Baijayanti, all doing separate businesses.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and other animals

loans.name: Evelin Suggey

texts.es:
Evelin tiene 23 años de edad, su estado civil es soltera, sin hijos a su cargo, vive en casa de sus padres en el distrito de Oyotun en la provincia de Chiclayo en la región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú, en este distrito la población se dedica a la agricultura y a la criá y venta de animales de corral este lugar es una zona rural.

Evelin se dedica al comercio criá y vende sus animales de corral con años de experiencia en este negocio solicita préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa el monto es de 2000 nuevos soles para la compra de animales pequeños y el mejoramiento del corral de estos para obtener mejores resultados e ingresos y así apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Evelin is 23 years' old and she is single and doesn't have any children. She lives in her parents' house in the Oyotun district in the Chiclayo province in the Lambayque region on the north coast of Peru. It is a rural region and the inhabitants of this district make a living working in agriculture and by raising and selling farmyard animals.

Evelin makes a living by raising and selling her animals, with years' of experience in the business. She is requesting a loan of 2, 000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy small animals and to improve the animals' pen so she can get better results and earn a better income to support her family.

loans.use: to invest in her business- to buy guinea pigs, ducks and hens.

loans.name: Eni Olivia

texts.es:
Eni tiene 39 años de edad,estado civil conviviente,con 2 hijos a su cargo, vive en casa propia la cual esta ubicada en el caserío de Las Delicias en el distrito de Oyotun en la provincia de Chiclayo en el departamento de Lambayeque - Perú, este caserío se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza y venta de animales de corral este lugar es una zona rural

Eni se dedica al comercio criá y vende animales de corral con varios años de experiencia en el negocio solicita préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa el monto es de 1000 nuevos soles para la compra de animales pequeños para tener un stock de estos y luego de unos meses aumentar sus ingresos para apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Eni is 39 years old, partnered, with 2 children in her care. She lives in her own house which is located in the Las Delicias area of Oyotun district in Chiclayo province, Lambayeque department, Perú. This area is agricultural and people raise and sell farm animals, it is a rural zone.

Eni works raising and selling farm animals with a number of years of experience in this business. She asks Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles to purchase small animals to have a stock of them and, after a few months, increase her income to support her family.

loans.use: to invest in her business - purchase guinea pigs, ducks and chickens.

loans.name: Maria Reyes

texts.es: María de 45 años de edad vive con su esposo. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se desempeña vendiendo productos por catálogo, además su esposo trabaja como reciclador lo que le permite aportar a la economía familiar. María desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda por lo que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para comprar: lámina galvanizada, clavos y pines, además pagará mano de obra necesaria para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en: María, 45 years old, lives with her husband. She is an enterprising woman and gets along selling catalog products, in addition her husband works as a recycler, which permits him to support the family economy. María wants to replace the roof on her house, so she asks FUSAI for a loan to purchase galvanized metal sheeting, nails and pins, and additionally to pay the labor costs necessary to replace the roof of her house.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized metal sheeting, nails, and pins, and additionally to pay the labor costs necessary to replace the roof of her house.

loans.name: Hy

texts.en:
At the age of 44 years old, Hy is living in a community of Prey Chhor District of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a mother of one married child and four dependent children. To support the family, she is working very hard on her own rice field by growing rice and selling the crop to the local dealers and customers in the market. The net profit that she can generate is USD $5 a day.

To keep her rice growing well and more fruitful, she normally uses natural fertilizers in her farmland. However, now she can’t afford that fertilizer as she used to do regularly. She is now requesting a loan to buy some fertilizers to use on her rice farmland. She would like to thank lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone and a solar charging set so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Rubabe

texts.en:
Rubabe is 49 years old. She is divorced. Her husband left Rubabe with two children, and since then, she has grown her children alone. 

Now she is living with her lovely family at Govshad village of Fuzuli region as a refugee, so that her family members have been IDPs (internally displaced persons) from Fuzuli city for 20 years. 

Rubabe has a vegetables and fruits store. Today, Rubabe is planning to support her business, and for that, she needs 1,900 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy more seasonal products. She says thanks to the Kiva organization and lenders for a loan and help. In the future, she wants to increase her monthly income and to give a good education to her children.

loans.use: to pay for more seasonal products

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is aged 52, married to a farmer and blessed with three children. She has managed a retail store in their village for almost 18 years and earns a net income of 500 PHP (Philippines pesos) daily. 

Due to insufficient funds, she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 20,000 to purchase cooking oil, sugar, coffee, food seasonings and detergent soap to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil, sugar, coffee, food seasonings and detergent soap to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone and a solar charging set so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone and a solar charging set  so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Basajja Market Group

texts.en:
Shamila is a member of Bassajabalaba Market Group. She is a 24-year-old married woman who is a market vendor in a market located in cell A ward iv Ishaka division Bushenyi district in Uganda. She has a 2-year-old daughter.

She sells smoked fish in order to supplement her husband's meager income.  He is a court broker in the Bushenyi district. 

She works 8 hours a day and started this business two years ago. and she says it She loves this business because it had been her father’s business since she was young. 

She is a first time borrower with UGAFODE Micro-finance and requests 500,000 (Five hundred thousand shillings). She hopes to buy more fish using this money. Her customers include students from Kampala International University and other members of the community. 

She hopes to build her own house on a plot she has already bought with her husband. Her business challenges include dealing with clients who buy but do not pay on time.   She describes herself as a self motivated and focused young mother. 

She thanks UGAFODE Microfinance for being there for the low income earners and helping her improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone and a solar charging set  so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Cinderella Group

texts.en: Salima, a member of Cinderella group, is 30 years old. She operates a boutique located in Makindye, a suburb, and has been in business for the last two years. She saved some money when she was teaching since she is a teacher by profession. Salimah believes working for others cannot generate enough income to look after the family very well, so she started her own business selling ladies' clothes, and it is doing well. Salimah has hopes of expanding her business so that she can serve all her customers' needs. Since the trends keep changing, she wants to be able to buy as the trends change. Salimah approached UGAFODE for a second loan of 1,000,000 UGX to invest in her business. Salimah is humble and hard working and thanks UGAFODE and Kiva lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone and a solar charging set  so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Katokye Twesigye Mukama Group

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a 36-year-old experienced client and a member of Katookye Twesigye mukama group.  

He is married and has four children who are 10, 8, 6 and 2 years old.  Three attend school.  

He has applied for a loan of 1000,000 (one million shillings) through the group to buy two cows for his business. Cattle trading is his major source of income.  He is a hard working man and works 8 hours a day, 6 days a week. He has a motorcycle for a "boda boda" business to increase his income. 

He started his business in 2009 to earn an income to look after his family. He works in his local area of Katokye Rwamujojo Kabwohe Sheema and his clients are cattle traders.

He hopes to be financially stable and educate his children. He faces competition from fellow cattle traders but is determined to beat the competition. He hopes to increase his business.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Nazgul

texts.ru: Назгул 36 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Назгул - среднее образование, с 1996 года в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством и земледелием. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Назгул на сегодняшний день имеется 3 коровы, 2 из них дойные и 24 овцы. Также есть 0,60 ГА собственной земли, где Назгул и ее семья выращивают злаковые и эспарцет для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. На ежедневной основе Назгул продает молоко, а также овощи и фрукты, выращиваемые в саду. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях увеличения своего бизнеса Назгул обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров. Доходы от кредита Назгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, ей нужно закупить корм и сено для скота.
texts.en: Nazgul is 36, married, and has five children. She has a secondary education and has been raising livestock and planting crops since 1996. This is the main source of income for her family. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has three cows, two of which are dairy cows, and 24 sheep. She also has 0.60 hectares of her own land where she and her family grow grasses and sainfoin for their own use and to sell. Nazgul sells milk and fruits and vegetables from her garden every day, earning 15,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to expand her business, Nazgul applied for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank in order to purchase cows. She plans to use her profits to invest in additional livestock and she needs to buy feed and hay for the animals.

loans.use: To purchase cows and buy hay and feed for livestock

loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life Toilets

loans.name: Lidia Esperanza

texts.es: Lidia de 61 años de edad vive con su madre y su hijo. Ella es una mujer tenaz que desde hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de pupusas negocio que le ha permitido dar soporte económico a su familia, su hijo también aporta a la economía del hogar gracias a su trabajo. Lidia desea instalar energía eléctrica en su vivienda por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: derecho de instalación, alambre, interruptores y tubos, además deberá pagar mano de obra para la instalación de energía eléctrica en su vivienda.
texts.en: Lidia is 61 years old and lives with her mother and her son. Lidia is a determined woman who, for ten years, has made a living selling "pupusas" (cream cheese tortillas stuffed with rice, beans or meat). This work has allowed Lidia to support her family financially. Lidia's son also supports the family economy thanks to his work. Lidia wants to install electricity in her home and so is applying for a loan from FUSAI. She will use it to pay for a licence to install electricity; to buy wire, switches and tubes; and to pay labourers to install electricity.

loans.use: to pay for a licence to install electricity; to buy wire, switches and tubes; and to pay labourers to install electricity.

loans.name: Sibani Group

texts.en:
Ramba, aged about 25 years, is a group leader from Tentuliamunda, Saragaj, Tarbha, in the district of Subarnapur, Odisha, India. She has a small family comprising five members: her husband, two sons and one daughter. The member standing sixth from the left with a raised hand is Ramba. 

At present, she is running a grocery shop in her locality. She sells rice, dal, tea, sugar, chocolate, etc., in her shop. Her husband also does daily labor work. She is a very active lady who wants  some extra income out of her own efforts.

Ramba’s husband is assisting her to run the business smoothly in purchasing grocery items from the nearby town. At present, her family income is 5,000 rupees per month from the grocery shop and labor work, which is not sufficient to maintain her family.
 
To improve her living conditions and to earn some extra income, she wants to avail a loan from Mahashakti. From the loan amount, she will purchase grocery items in a bulk quantity to avail a cash discount and also save transportation costs, which she incurs frequently. She has a dream to increase her business and educate her children in a better school.

The other 13 members of her group are Subarna, Subid, Luchana, Sanju, Surya, Gubha, Kunti, Rajeswari, Santoshini, Saptama, Khali, Brajeswari and Sabya, who are doing individual businesses.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a youth residing in Nairobi. She has been working as an attendant at a retail shop and has developed an interest in running her own business. This led her to learn about a partnership between Fresh Life and the youth to help them set up and run their own franchises. 

Margaret seeks a loan to be used as seed capital for setting up two Fresh Life toilets and hopes that her business will be successful enough to enable her to establish more franchises. She also hopes to see the sanitation challenge being faced in the community averted.

loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life Toilets

loans.name: Maria Lucia

texts.es: María de 40 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos de 19, 13 y 6 años de edad. Ella es una mujer tenaz que desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir tales como: blusas, faldas, pantalones, además de eso vende sandalias, actividades que realiza de forma ambulante en el mercado central. María desea construir ventanas a 3 cuartos de su vivienda por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena y hierro además deberá pagar mano de obra necesaria para hacer las construcciones en su vivienda.
texts.en:
María, 40, lives with her husband and 3 children aged 19, 13, and 6 years old. She is a strong woman who for the last 4 years has been selling clothing such as blouses, skirts, pants, and sandals in the central street market. 
María wants to build windows in 3 rooms of her home, so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, and iron; and she also has to pay for necessary labor.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and iron, and to pay for labor, to build windows in her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Ganesh Group

texts.en:
Sumitra, 32 years of age, is the leader of a group that hails from Nagpali, Tarbha in the district of Subarnapur, Odisha, India. She has a small family comprised of five members: her husband, two sons and one daughter.  The member sitting first from the right with a raised hand is Sumitra.

Sumitra and her husband are doing paddy cultivation, along with vegetables. They do vegetables for four months after the harvesting of paddy and earn handsome money. Her husband takes vegetable seeds, vegetable plants and fertilizers from the town for vegetable cultivation. Sumitra, along with 11 other members of her locality formed a group to avail a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for development of their existing businesses.

Now she is very much confident in doing vegetable cultivation and has developed her business significantly. At present, her monthly income is about 6,000 rupees. She wants to avail a further loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers for vegetable and paddy cultivation to earn some money. She has a long desire to educate her children in a better school.

The other 11 members of her groups are Anusaya, Bhama, Pramila, Shanti, Gitanjali, Bhumi, Bila, Jayanti, Parbati, Joshobanti and Jhuli, all doing separate businesses of their own.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for vegetable and paddy cultivation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone and a solar charging set so that he may provide vital farming information to his community

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new chair, a face massage machine, and to renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, a generator and air-conditioner.

loans.name: Elvia Nataly

texts.es: Elvia de 26 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 8 y 2 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que desde hace 3 años se gana la vida por medio de la venta de ropa interior, dicha actividad la realiza de forma ambulante en el mercado de su municipio, además su esposo aporta a la economía familiar gracias a su trabajo de motorista. Elvia desea colocar ventanas en su vivienda ya que como se observa en la fotografía solo ha colocado balcones por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: 5 ventanas para su vivienda.
texts.en:
Elvia is 26 years old and lives with her husband and two children, who are 8 and 2 years old. She is a dynamic woman who for the last three years has earned a living selling underwear. She sells her wares as a street vendor at the local market in her town. Also, her husband contributes to the family budget through his job as a driver. 

Elvia wants to install windows in her house, because, as you can see in the photo, she has only installed bars. For this reason she requested a loan from FUSAI to buy 5 windows for her house.

loans.use: to buy 5 windows for her house.

loans.name: Marta Vicenta

texts.es: Marta de 37 años de edad es madre soltera y vive con su hijo de 16 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que desde hace 17 años se dedica a la venta de cocos, golosinas y bebidas heladas. Marta desea instalar energía eléctrica en su vivienda por lo que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para comprar: derecho de instalación, alambre, interruptores, toma corrientes y tubos para realizar la instalación de energía eléctrica en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Marta is a 37-year-old single mother who lives with her 16-year-old son.  She is an enterprising woman who has made a living selling coconuts, sweets, and cold drinks for 17 years.  

She wants to install electricity in her home, so she is asking FUSAI for a loan to pay the installation fee and buy wire, switches, sockets, and tubing.

loans.use: to pay the installation fee and buy wire, switches, sockets, and tubing to install electricity in her house

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is 48 years old and married with eight children. She earns a living by vegetable farming in the Philippines. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. Evelyn has been vegetable farming for 10 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en: Mylene works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net for her business. Mylene has been in this business for three years now. In the future, Mylene would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more kitchen supplies and blankets, and to renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, embroidery machine  and a table.

loans.name: Remegilda

texts.en: Remegilda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell round timber business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional round timber and to pay for her laborers salaries. Remegilda has been in this business for 10 years now. In the future, Remegilda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional round timber and to pay for her laborers salaries.

loans.name: Rubelyn

texts.en: Rubelyn is 34 years old and has one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.  Rubelyn has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years, and also earns an income from motorcycle transport. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling frozen goods in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell for her frozen goods business.

Ruth has been in this business for 10 years. Ruth earns more income from raising chickens.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy frozen goods to sell

loans.name: Leopoldo

texts.es: Leopoldo de 39 años de edad vive con su su madre y un hermano. Él es un hombre trabajador que desde hace 16 años se gana la vida vendiendo colchas y cubrecamas, actividad que realiza de forma ambulante en la capital del país y municipios aledaños. Leopoldo desea reparar el techo de su vivienda por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina, clavos, polines y pines para realizar las reparaciones necesarias del techo de su vivienda, para lo cual también deberá pagar mano de obra.
texts.en:
Leopoldo is 39 years old and lives with his mother and brother.  He is a hard worker and since the age of 16 he has made a living selling quilts and bedspreads, which he does by traveling around the capital of the country and the surrounding towns.  

Leopoldo wants to repair the roof of his home, so he is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy steel sheeting, nails, lumber, and pins to make the necessary repairs on the roof of his house, for which he will also need to pay for labor.

loans.use: to buy steel sheeting, nails, lumber, and pins to make the necessary repairs to the roof of his house

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe  TIESSIRI  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  34 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KOLONDIEBA, une des préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités à tout moment. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution et compte bien le rembourser.Mme  SAFIATOU  2ème personne sur la photo de la droite à la gauche  compte acheter avec son prêt 2 sacs de tubercules. Elle vend quotidiennement à KOLONDIEBA et est très sollicitée surtout le jour de foire.Elle s’approvisionne à KOLONDIEBA. Elle vend au comptant à une clientèle mixte.Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 7 500FCFA.Ce bénéfice va la permettre de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The members of the Tiessiri group are married women averaging 34 years of age, wtih three children. They all live in polygamous families in Kolondieba, a prefecture in the third administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better manage their business at all times. They are on their second loan with Soro Yiriwaso and plan to repay it without issues. Mrs. Safiatou, the second one from right to left in the photo, plans to use her loan to buy two bags of tubers. She sells every day in Kolondieba and has lots of customers, especially on market days. She stocks up in Kolondieba. She sells for cash, to a mixed customer base. She plans to earn an average monthly revenue of 7,500 West African francs. This revenue will allow her to pay off her loan and also help her husband with everyday expenses.

loans.use: to buy tubers.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
Maria tiene 51 años de edad; su estado civil es conviviente, sin hijos a su cargo; cuenta con casa propia la cual esta ubicada en el distrito de Oyotun en la provincia de Chiclayo en la región de Lambayeque - Perú, en este distrito se dedican a la agricultura y a la criá - venta de animales de corral, este lugar es una zona rural.

Maria se dedica al comercio criá y venta de animales de corral con varios años de experiencia en el rubro solicita préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa el monto es de 1300 nuevos soles lo cual invertirá en el arreglo del corral de sus animales y al mejoramiento de su vivienda para una mejor calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 51 years old.  She lives with a partner and has no children in her care.  She has her own house which is located in the district of Oyotun, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, Peru.  In this rural area, most people make a living in agriculture and by raising and selling barnyard animals.  

Maria makes a living raising and selling barnyard animals commercially and she had many years of experience in this field.  She is asking for a loan of 1300 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa, which she will invest in the repair of the corral for her animals and the improvement of her home for a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to invest in construction and buy corrugated iron for her bedroom

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Thelma works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending.  Thelma is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

Thelma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 51 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, noodles, eggs, milk, etc.

Veronica has borrowed and paid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 35 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, noodles, eggs, milk, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for the family business.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es: María de 56 años de edad es madre soltera y vive con su hija y tres nietos. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que desde hace seis años se dedica a la crianza de pollos, actividad que realiza en su vivienda, además vende variedad de ropa interior en su cantón, lo que le permite tener un ingreso extra. María desea terminar de construir su vivienda, ya que como se observa en la fotografía las paredes están a la mitad por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava, lámina y polines para terminar de construir su vivienda y ponerle techo para poder vivir en ella lo antes posible.
texts.en:
María is a 56-year-old single mother who lives with her daughter and three grandchildren.  She is an enterprising woman who has made a living raising chickens at home for 6 years, as well as selling a variety of underwear in her canton, which permits her to bring in extra income.  

Maria wants to finish building her house, since as you can see in the photo, the walls are halfway up.  Therefore, she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy bricks, cement, sand, gravel, sheet metal and lumber to finish building her home and put a roof on it so that she can live in in at soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, gravel, sheet metal, and lumber to finish building her house

loans.name: Sameera

texts.en:
Sameera is a 35-year-old, married woman from Jericho. She is a mother for six kids, three sons and three daughters. She has a chicken and dove coop.  She sells the meat and eggs in the city. It is a good business, but it needs a lot of effort.  Sameera took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more chicks for her coop. By taking this loan, Sameera will be able to increase her productivity and also her income. 

Sameera appears in the photo next to the chicken and dove coop.

loans.use: to buy more chicks for her coop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood frames for his construction business.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo es un joven emprendedor, tiene 21 años de edad, es soltero y vive en Pachacamac junto a su familia.
Es una persona trabajadora, quiere sacar adelante a su familia y darle todas las comodidades que se merecen. Sus padres con lo poco que tenían lo formaron como una persona de bien, responsable y honrado. Desde hace más de 1 año viene desempeñándose como mototaxista y le va muy bien porque siempre se esfuerza por realizar bien su labor y se preocupa por el bienestar de los clientes al momento de realizar el servicio.
Guillermo está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar una refrigeradora para su domicilio, para que de esta manera pueda guardar sus alimentos y sean más duraderos, con esto estará mejorando su calidad de vida y seguirá luchando para más adelante poder comprar una flota de motos e iniciar un negocio.
texts.en:
Guillermo is an enterprising young man; he is 21 years old, single and lives in Pachacamac with his family. 

He is a hard working individual, he wants to support his family and give them all the commodities that they deserve. His parents with the little that they had raised him to be a good person, responsible and honest.

For over a year he has worked as a moto-taxi driver and it is going well for him because he always strives to do a good job and is concerned with the wellbeing of his customers when carrying out his duties. 
 
Guillermo is very grateful with Kiva investors because with the support they have provided him he will be able to buy a refrigerator for his home, and thus be able to store his food and make it last longer. With this he will be improving his quality of life and he will continue to work to buy a fleet of bikes and start a business in the future.

loans.use: Buy a refrigerator for his home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more olive tree seedlings for the family farm

loans.name: Maksudahan

texts.ru: Максудахан 36 лет, замужем, 6 дочерей, образование высшее педагогическое, уже много лет работает учителем математики. Дополнительно с 2008 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, на сегодняшний день в своем хозяйстве Максудахан имеет 3 коровы, одна из них - дойная, 2 овцы. Также на 0,03 ГА собственной земли выращивает картофель и морковь, на 0,10 ГА - кукурузу, в саду растут малина яблоневые деревья. Максудахан  знает технологию ведения сельскохозяйственной деятельности и умеет вкладывать средства по назначению. Ее ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров. Максудахан намерена увеличить поголовье скота, а доходы от кредита позволят ей накопить средства на образование дочерей.
texts.en: Maksudahan is 36 years old, married and the mother of six daughters. She has a college degree in education and has been working as a math teacher for many years. In addition, since 2008 she has been raising livestock and growing farm produce. At present Maksudahan’s farm includes three cows (one dairy cow among them) and two sheep. She grows potatoes and carrots on 0.03 ha [0.07 acres] of own land, and corn on 0.10 ha [0.25 acres]. In her garden she has planted apple trees and raspberries. Maksudahan is familiar with the farm management techniques and knows how to invest properly. Her total monthly income is about 10,000 KGS. In order to develop her farm further, Maksudahan has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 50,000 KGS to buy cows. Maksudahan plans to increase her livestock headcount. The revenue resulting from her loan will allow her to bolster her savings intended for her daughters’ education.

loans.use: to buy a cow in order to  earn a larger profit and save for her children's education.

loans.name: Delmi Del Carmen

texts.es: Delmi de 34 años de edad vive es madre soltera y vive con sus 3 hijos de 15, 11 y 10 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se dedica a la venta de juguetes, artesanías y dulces artesanales, actividad que realiza de forma ambulante desde hace 8 años. Delmi desea encementar el piso de su vivienda y cambiar el techo de la misma ya que como se observa en la fotografía no se encuentra en buenas condiciones. Por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI  para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, lámina galvanizada y madera, además deberá pagar mano de obra necesaria para hacer dichas mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Delmi is a 34-year-old single mother who lives with her three children who are ten, eleven and fifteen years old. She is an entrepreneurial woman who makes a living as a street vendor selling games, handmade items and traditional candy, which she has been doing for the past eight years.

Delmi wants to cement the floor in her home and change the roof as well, and as one can see in the photo, she does not live in good conditions. This is the reason she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy: cement, sand, gravel, galvanized sheets and wood, in addition to paying for the necessary labor costs to make the previously mentioned improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, galvanized sheets and wood, in addition to paying for the labor costs to cement the floor and change the roof of her home.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy an iron, sewing machine, and overlock sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more beans and legumes for his restaurant.

loans.name: Sami

texts.en:
Sami is a 24-year-old married man from Qalqilya city. He lives with his wife in a small house. 

Sami has a sewing workshop which has been open for the past two years. It is a good business and the demand is high. Sami would like to improve his business and expand it.

Sami took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new sewing machine for his workshop. By taking this loan, Sami will be able to improve his work quality and also his income.

Sami appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for his workshop.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is married with five children. She lives with her family in a three-bedroom house in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. She has encountered a good number of problems in life which include the following: the deaths of family members, sickness in her family, and also theft.

With this new loan, she will buy yam seeds for her farm; she will also buy bean seeds and vegetable seeds for her farm. She will also buy fertilizer for her crops. Part of the loan will be used to pay for the laborers that will help her on her farm. She is positive that her business will succeed because she will put in place all types of measures for her farm. Also, with the ready market source the crops are in high demand. The community will benefit from the regular supply of her farm for their families.

With the profit from the loan, she will cater to her children by providing good food to them. She will also sponsor her children in schools. She prefers loan from GHAPE because of the low interest, convenient repayment intervals, and also advice on business management that GHAPE provides.

loans.use: to buy yam seeds, bean seeds, vegetable seeds, and fertilizer, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Awah Marie

texts.en:
Awah Marie is married with five children. She lives with her family in a four bedroom house in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced a good number of problems in life which include the following: sickness, the death of her sister and child, and poverty. And still she started up a business of her own.

With this new loan, she will buy more food items such as vegetable for retail. She will buy tomatoes, groundnuts, rice, oil, coco yams in bags, and smoked fish. Also she will buy drinks for her restaurant, and part of the loan will be used to pay for her market space. She is positive that her business will succeed because she has being selling for so long and she has a good market site, with ready customers. 

With the profit from the loan, she will pay for her children's school fees and provide good medication and food to her children. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals, and also advice on business management.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, tomatoes, coco yams, oil, smoked fish, and pay for market space.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
She is married with seven children. They both in a four bedroom apartment in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced some problems in life which include the following; sickness, the death of her family members, and an accident that almost took away her life and that of her son. Also, poverty in her family has been a general problem.

With this new loan requested, she will buy her garden chemicals, which include insecticide, pesticide, and fungicide. Also she will buy vegetable seedlings, tomato seedlings, and part of this loan will be used to buy some cereals for her gardening. She believes that her business will succeed because she has been working in the garden for a long time and has a good market site with ready customers.

With the profit from the loan, she will pay for her children's education and provide good medication for her family. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals and also the trainings offered to members before loans are given.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seedlings, tomato seedlings, fertilizer, and chemicals.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
She is married with four children. They all live in a two bedroom apartment in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced some problems in life which include the following: sickness, the death of her family members and inability to pay for her children’s education. Also poverty in her family has been a general problem.

With this new loan requested, she will buy seedlings such as beans, corn, cassava tubers, and vegetable seedlings for her farm. Part of this loan will be used to buy fertilizer. She believes that her business will succeed because she has been working on the farm for a long time, and has a good market site with ready customers.

With the profit from the loan, she will pay for her children's education and provide good medication for her family. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals and also the trainings offered to members before loans are given.

loans.use: to buy seedlings such as yams, corn, cassava and fertilizers

loans.name: Yvan

texts.es:
Yvan tiene 34 años de edad, su estado civil es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos a su cargo, cuenta con casa propia en el distrito de Oyotun en la provincia de Chiclayo en el departamento de Lambayeque - Perú, en este distrito se dedican a la agricultura y a la crianza y venta de animales de corral dicho lugar es una zona rural.

Yvan es comerciante criá y vende animales de corral, tales como patos, gallinas, hanchos, etc, solicita préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por el monto de 2000 nuevos soles los cuales invertirá en compra de animales pequeños y así poder tener un stock numeroso de estos con lo cual logrará aumentar sus ingresos y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Yvan is 34 years old. His marital status is cohabitation and has two dependent children. He owns a house in the Oyotun district, which is located in the province of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque department, Peru. In this district, people make a living working in agriculture and raising and selling farmyard animals. The said place is a rural area.

Yvan is a merchant. He raises and sells farmyard animals such as ducks, hens, pigs, and the like. He is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2,000  nuevo soles, which he will invest in the purchase of small animals. In this way, he will be able to have a sizeable stock, which will allow him to increase his income and, thus, improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of guinea pigs, ducks, hens, and the like for his business.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is married with five children. She lives with her family in a four bedroom house in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced a good number of problems in life which include the following: sickness, the death of family members including her mother and father, and also theft. She has reached a turning point in her life since she joined the program, and she has successfully repaid her loan three times. 

With this new loan, she will buy more drinks for her restaurant, and she will buy coco yams in bags, vegetable oil, and smoked fish. She will buy comfortable chairs for the convenience of her customers. She is positive that her business will succeed because she will put in place all types of drinks and improve the look of the food in her restaurant. She has regular customers and a good business site, and from this business the community will benefit from the regular supply of food and drinks, which are mostly consumed during ceremonies.

With the profit from the loan, she will cater to herself and her children by providing good medication, food for her children, and also sponsor their education. She prefers loans from GHAPE because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals, and also advice on business management.

loans.use: to buy coco yams, oil, and smoked fish, and to buy more drinks for her restaurants.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
He is married and blessed with five children. They all live in a five-bedroom apartment in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. He has faced some difficulties in life which are sickness and the death of his son who was supportive to his family. He has also faced land problems after the death of his father, and inadequate capital. Starting up an income generating activity in life was also not possible for him.

With this new loan requested, he will buy his seedlings such as beans, corn and yams. Part of this loan will be used to buy fertilizer and for the clearing of the farm. He believes that this activity will succeed because he has been working on the farm with his parents since childhood. Also the high demand for food crops in the local market makes a ready marketing source.

With the profit from the loan, he will pay for his children’s education and provide good medication for his family. He prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals and also the trainings offered to members before loans are disbursed.

loans.use: to buy seedlings such as yams, corn, beans, fertilizers, and pay for the clearing of the farm.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
She is married with five children. She lives with her family in a four-bedroom house in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon.

She has encountered a good number of problems in life which include the following; the death of family members, sickness in her family and also theft. She reached the turning point of her life since she joined GHAPE in the year 2009 and has managed and successfully repaid three of her loans.

With this new loan, she will buy more drinks for her off license which was opened with the help of the first loan from GHAPE. She will also buy more crates and bottles and construct a good counter to display her drinks. She will buy comfortable chairs for the convenience of her customers. She is positive that her business will succeed because she will put in place all types of drinks. She has regular customers with a good business site and from this business the community will benefit from a regular supply of drinks which are mostly consumed during ceremonies.

With the profit from the loan, she will cater to herself and her children by providing good food to her children and also sponsoring their education. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals and also advice on business management provided by GHAPE.

loans.use: to buy crates, bottles, chairs, drinks, and cups

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase Facebook ads to market her business and become more visible.

loans.name: David

texts.es: David de 53 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos de 17, 13 y 12 años de edad. Él es un hombre emprendedor que se gana la vida como albañil desde hace 30 años, además se dedica a la siembra de maíz, y también junto a su esposa tiene un pequeño negocio de crianza de cerdos y gallinas. David desea instalar energía eléctrica en su vivienda, por lo que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para comprar: cables, alambres, interruptores y caja térmica eléctrica, además deberá pagar derecho de instalación de energía eléctrica.
texts.en:
David, age 53, lives with his wife and their three children, ages 17, 13, and 12.  He is an enterprising man who has earned a living as a bricklayer for 30 years.  He also grows corn.  He also, together with his wife, has a small business raising pigs and chickens.

David wishes to install electricity in his house.  That is why he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy cables, wire, switches, and a thermal electrical box.  He will also need to pay for the right to install electricity.

loans.use: to buy cables, wire, switches, and a thermal electrical box.  He will also need to pay for the right to install electricity.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco tiene 59 años de edad, su estado civil soltero sin hijos a su cargo cuenta con casa propia la cual esta ubicada en el distrito de Oyotún en la provincia de Chiclayo en la región de Lambayeque - Perú, en este distrito se dedican a la crianza y venta de animales de corral y también a la agricultura este lugar es una zona rural.

Francisco se dedica al comercio criá y vende animales de corral como son patos ,chanchos,cuyes,etc solicita préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa el monto es de 1000 nuevos soles este dinero lo invertirá en la compra de animales pequeños y a mejorar el corral de estos para que luego de unos meses obtenga mejores resultados en lo económico y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Francisco, age 59, is single and does not have children under his care.  He has his own house in the Oyotún district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, Peru.  People in this district raise and sell barnyard animals.  They also work in agriculture; this is a rural area.

Francisco raises and sells barnyard animals like ducks, pigs, and guinea pigs.  He is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 soles.  He will use this money to buy small animals and to improve the animals’ pen.  He will do this so that he will then get better financial results and improve the quality of his life.

loans.use: to buy ducks, pigs, and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 58 years old and married with six children. With two children in school, Elena works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. Elena has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future Elena would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Eleonor works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from furniture making. Eleonor is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell in her rice retailing business.

Eleonor has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 53 years old and married with five children, three of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Helen has borrowed and paid back 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Maritza Guadalupe

texts.es: Maritza de 25 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y su hija de 9 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que desde hace 3 años se gana la vida vendiendo zapatos, actividad que realiza en su cantón. Además viendo la necesidad de tener más ingresos vende camarones una vez al mes para obtener un ingreso extra. Maritza desea comenzar a construir su vivienda, pues por el momento habita en la vivienda de su tío, ya que solo cuenta con el terreno que se observa en la fotografía, por lo que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para comprar: ladrillo y cemento para construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maritza, age 25, lives with her life partner and her nine year old daughter.  She is an enterprising woman who has earned a living selling shoes for three years.  She sells in her canton.  Also, upon seeing the need to have more income, she sells shrimp once a month to get an extra income.

Maritza wishes to start building her house.  For the moment, she is living in her uncle’s house.  She only has the land, which is what is seen in the photograph.  That is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy bricks and cement to build her house.

loans.use: Para comprar: ladrillo, arena y cemento para construir su vivienda.

loans.name: Jirah Dawn

texts.en:
Jirah Dawn is 24 years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Jirah Dawn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, etc.

Jirah Dawn has been in this business for three years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, etc

loans.name: Jusilin

texts.en:
Jusilin is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fish net and other fishing materials for her fishing business.

Jusilin has been in this business for four years. She earns more income from a general store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy fish net and other fishing materials

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie works hard to support her family. She is married and has an ambulant rice vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell.

Lenie has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Lenie would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Leova

texts.en:
Leova is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling live fish in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more live fish to sell for her business buying and selling live fish.

Leova has been in this business for one year. She earns more income from rice retailing.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more live fish to sell.

loans.name: I Kadek

texts.en:
This is I Kadek’s first loan with MUK. He’s a tailor and his business is located in the market near his house. I Kadek has two daughters. The first daughter is in high school and the second is still in junior high school. I Kadek lives with his wife and together they have been running the business since they married. As the head of the family, I Kadek has the responsibility to fulfill his family's needs.

I Kadek is known as a good tailor, but because of the little capital he had, sometimes he hasn’t received all his customers' orders. To overcome the capital problem, I Kadek proposes a loan of 3,000,000 IDR to use to purchase cloth, thread, needles and many tailoring tools. He hopes he can improve his service to the customers and make more profit. He has a dream of buying a new sewing machine from the profits.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, thread, needles and many tailoring tools

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga tiene 31 años de edad, su estado civil es conviviente, con 1 hijo a su cargo cuenta con casa propia la cual esta ubicada en el distrito de Oyotun en la provincia de Chiclayo en la región de Lambayeque - Perú, en este distrito se dedican a la agricultura y la crianza - venta de animales de corral este lugar es zona rural.

Olga de dedica al comercio criá y vende animales de corral con varios años de experiencia en el rubro solicita préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa el monto es de 1500 nuevos soles para la compra de animales pequeños los cuales en dos meses crecerán y venderá por lo que obtendrá mayores ingresos y apoyara a su familia.
texts.en:
Olga is 31 years old and lives with her partner with 1 dependent child. She has her own home which is located in the Oyotun district of the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region of Peru. This rural district makes a living in agriculture and the raising and selling of barnyard animals.

Olga makes a living from the animal trade and she has several years of experience in the field of selling barnyard animals. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,500 Nuevos Soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy small animals which will grow up and be sold within two months. This will bring in more income and support her family.

loans.use: with working capital – to buy guinea pigs, chickens and ducks.

loans.name: Pazilet

texts.ru: Пазилет 58 лет, вдова, мать 6 детей. У Пазилет - среднее образование, с 1991 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Пазилет, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 4 коровы. На собственном участке, мерою 0,65 ГА, она выращивает картофель, на 0,35 ГА - морковь и на 0,35 ГА - пшеницу для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежедневно продает молоко местным жителям. Экологически чистая и вкусная сельскохозяйственная продукция Пазилет пользуется большим спросом, принося ежемесячный доход около 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Пазилет обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку двух дойных коров, для увеличения реализации молока. Доходы от кредита помогут Пазилет улучшить ее материальные и жилищные условия.
texts.en: Pazilet is 58 years old, a widow and a mother of 6 children. Pazilet has a secondary education and has been involved in animal husbandry and farming since 1991. Thanks to Pazilet's hard work, today her business contains 4 cows. She grows potatoes on her 0.65 hectares of owned land, carrots on 0.35 hectares, and wheat for internal business consumption and sale on another 0.35 hectares. She sells milk to local residents daily. Pazilet's ecologically clean and delicious agricultural products are in high demand, yielding a monthly income of about 10,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Pazilet requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy two dairy cows to increase milk production. The earnings from the loan will help Pazilet improve her financial and living conditions.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows in order to increase milk production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a welder iron

loans.name: Rimma

texts.en:
Rimma is divorced. She has two daughters. One of them is a student. Rimma has her own business. 

Rimma sells clothes for women and teenagers. She has done this for more than 16 years. Rimma sells popular clothes and has good prices. She is always polite to her clients. Rimma wants to develop her business further.

Rimma is asking for a loan in the amount of 31,000 UAH to increase her assortment of fall clothes and school uniforms. This loan will help her to earn a larger income.

loans.use: to increase assortment of fall clothes and school uniforms

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase spare parts for the maintenance for her motorcycle transport business.

Lolita has been in this business for 22 years. She earns additional income from buy-and-sell dried fish.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her business.

loans.name: Eddison

texts.en: Eddison is 18 years old and the youngest child of Susan. He is a second year student. His mother is a retail store owner while his father is a farmer. Their income is not sufficient for all their expenses and that is why he is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to pay for his tuition fees and allowances. Someday Eddison hopes to finish his education and become a successful Marine Engineer and help lift his family's status of living.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and allowances.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 33 years old and married, with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a direct-selling personal collection business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional stocks to sell.

Maricel has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the direct-selling personal collection business for four years and also earns an income from buy-and-sell recycled materials.

She aspires to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is married and has seven children. They live in a four-bedroom house in Bamenda in the North West Region of Cameroon. He has faced so many challenges in life, including inadequate finances to educate his children, sickness, accidents, and death of family members.

He joined GHAPE in the year 2002 and has taken and repaid seven loans. He promises that if given the new loan requested, he will open a poultry farm in his area. The money will be used to buy chicks, drinking canes, medication, and food for the chicks. He will also use part of the loan for transportation to sell the chickens in the market. He says his business will succeed because he lives in a community that is suffering from inadequate poultry farms. Also, he has a good business site. The community will benefit from a regular supply of chicks for ceremonies and at moderate prices. And the waste from the fowls will be used as manure to boast crop yields.

He says with the profit from the loan, he will ensure a balanced diet for his family, save money for other investment, and provide adequate medication to his family. He says that a GHAPE loan is preferable because of low interest rates, installment payments, advice on management before loan disbursement, and education on other health problems.

loans.use: To buy chicks, feed, and medication

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 49 years old, married, with three beautiful children. She has been a wholesaler of bananas in their town for almost ten years. From this long-time experience of selling, she already has lots of knowledge about dealing with this kind of business. Even though there are many competitors in the town, Gemma still gets more customers than the rest, due to her good salesmanship and characteristic effort. She has been successful over the years and manages to save more money for her family. 

Now, Gemma is planning to buy a parcel of land in order to manage a new business, which is creating a small pigpen for additional income in the near future. To fund this project, she needs additional capital to purchase 100 kilos of bananas to sell wholesale, so she has requested a loan from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase 100 kilos of bananas to sell wholesale.

loans.name: Bita

texts.en:
Bita is 58 years old and blessed with four children. They live in a rural community and make their living through farming. Her younger daughter is now in college, studying for a Bachelor in Science degree in Criminology.

Due to the high cost of school fees, she was not able to finance all of her children's school fees. For this reason, she would like to avail an educational loan of 15,000 PHP to pay for her daughter's tuition fees and her board and lodging. She is hoping that lenders will approve her loan request to support the education of her child.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition fees as well as her board and lodging

loans.name: Rubi

texts.en:
Rubi is 61 years old and lives in Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed, with five children now at their adult age. 

Rubi has been engaged in an e-load retailing business to all networks for five years already and earns approximately PHP 1,000 each month doing this type of business activity. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional e-loads for her load wallet for retail.

Rubi has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for almost four years. In the future, she hopes to expand her e-loading business.

loans.use: to purchase additional electronic loads.

loans.name: Narra

texts.en:
Narra is 60 years old and married with seven children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

Narra has borrowed and paid back 25 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal retailing business for 10 years and also earns an income from farming rice and vegetables.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell cashew nuts business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 8,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy cashew nuts for her buy-and-sell cashew nuts business.

Jocelyn has been in this business for four years. She earns additional income from fish-vending.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy cashew nuts for her food production business.

loans.name: Cristine

texts.en:
Cristine is 20 years old and single. She is presently studying for a Bachelor of Science in Information Technology. She aims to finish her chosen course, so that she will find a good job someday and help her parents in gaining income to sustain their necessities and finance the education of her younger sister and brother. 

Due to hardship of living, her parents could not afford to finance all her necessities in school. For this reason, she would like to access educational assistance from Kiva lenders through ASKI, in the amount of PHP 10,000, to pay for her tuition fee, books, and school uniforms. Through this financial assistance, Cristine believes that she will be able to continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fee, books, and school uniforms.

location.town: Brgy. Mangayang, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Macaria

texts.en:
Macaria is 41 years old, married, and has four children. She is managing a small store to provide her income. She sells grocery items and is able to gain about 6,000 PHP monthly. She used her income to sustain the needs of her family, such as daily meals and school fees. She also used other parts of her income for revolving capital in her business. 

She is now asking for a loan of 29,000 PHP to buy canned goods, eggs, breads, noodles, soap, and shampoo to sell. She hopes to continue selling good products and services as well as to gain good profits for the development of her family's way of living.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, eggs, breads, noodles, soap, and shampoo to sell

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 49 years old, married, and blessed with three children. She is one of the store-owners in her community. Despite the hardships of living, she and her husband have the determination to uplift their status of living and educate their children. Due to the high cost of school fees, she was not able to finance the schooling of her children, most especially her daughter, who is now at the college level. 

For this reason, she would like to avail an educational loan, from KIVA lenders through ASKI, of 20,000 PHP to pay for the tuition fees, miscellaneous fees, books, and school uniforms for her daughter. She is hoping that this financial assistance will enable her to support the education of her daughter.

loans.use: to pay for the tuition fees, miscellaneous fees, books, and school uniforms for her daughther

loans.name: Jannette

texts.en: Jannette is 37 years old and a mother of two. She owns and manages a small retail store while her husband works on their farm. Despite the hardship of living, they have the determination to improve their status of living and educate their children. Due to the high cost of school fees and commodities, they need to increase their income to continuously support the education of their children. In this regard, Jannette aims to make her business more profitable to generate a higher income. Having inadequate capital, she would like to access financial assistance of 15,000 PHP from KIVA lenders to buy more stocks of snack foods, canned goods, laundry soaps, assorted candies, seasonings, beverages and soft drinks to resell in her store. She is hoping that this financial assistance will help her to make the business grow.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of snack foods, canned goods, laundry soaps, assorted candies, seasonings, beverages and soft drinks to resell

loans.name: Lonie

texts.en:
Lonie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years now.

Lonie has requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 56 years old and married with six children; one child is in school. Luzviminda works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for five years. 

Luzviminda has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell, like canned goods, chips, eggs, milk, sugar, and soap. In the future she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, like canned goods, chips, eggs, milk, sugar, and soap

loans.name: Manilyn

texts.en:
Manilyn is 21 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the store for one year and also earns an income from food vending.

Manilyn has requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell. She has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 55 years old and is a widow with seven children, one of whom is in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Nida has borrowed and paid back 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell nipa roofing business for 8 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Nida aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of roofing supplies to sell

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
José de 32 años de edad, en su tiempo de estudio logro estudiar hasta sexto grado. Esta casado desde hace 8 años, a procreado 1 hijo de 4 años de edad. Su esposa se dedica a los oficios domesticos, ella hace los oficios de la casa y ayuda a su esposo en la siembra de maíz. 

Desde hace 4 años inicio a trabajar como seguridad, hace mucho tiempo despues de salir de la escuela dice que él queria trabajar para  seguir estudiando; pero no le fue posible ya que solo trabajos en la finca le salian, entonces decidio dedicarse a la agricultura con su padre, y se dedico 3 años a la agricultura poco tiempo despues, metio curriculum en varios lugares pero en ningun lugar le salia hasta que un dia lo llamaron para trabajar de seguridad; por lo cual él sentia temor pero la necesidad de trabajar fue mas grande que acepto el reto y hoy ya tiene 4 años de dedicarse a eso, el trabajo le queda a 3 horas de su casa y viaja en bus. El horario es 24 horas trabajadas y 24 horas descansadas. Él siempre se dedica a la agricultura los días que tiene de descanzo.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para ayudar a su padre a comprar 2 sacos de abono para darle otra abonada a la milpa y ayudara a pagarle el moso para que le ayude a su padre, ya que su padre le da maiz y frijol cuando saca la cosecha, entonces José tiene que colaborarle a su padre. 

Sus sueños son que Dios le preste salud, larga vida ya que dice que esta dispuesto a trabajar fuerte para darle a su hijo algo bueno. Quiere que su hijo si pueda estudiar y ser un profecional, ya que él no pudo serlo. Tambien poder tener la oportunidad de seguir trabajando con su padre.
texts.en:
José is 32 years old.  While he was in school, he managed to study up to the sixth grade.  He has been married for eight years, and has a four-year-old son.  His wife makes a living doing house work; she also does the household chores and helps her husband harvest the corn.

Four years ago he started working in security.  Long after leaving school he said that he wanted to work in order to continue studying, but this was not possible because there was only work on the farm he was leaving.  So he decided to dedicate himself to farming with his father, and he made a living in agriculture for three years.  A little time later, he left his résumé in various places but none of them worked out until one day they called him to work in security, of which he was afraid but the need to work was much greater so he accepted the challenge and today he has spent four years making a living this way.  Work is three hours away from his house, and he travels by bus.  The schedule is 24 hours on the job, then 24 hours off.  He always works in agriculture on the days he has off.

The loan that he is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to help his father buy two sacks of manure in order to fertilize his corn field again and to help pay the young man that assists his father, since his father gives him corn and beans when he collects the harvest.  Thus, José has to collaborate with his father.

José's dreams are for God to provide him health and long life since he says he is willing to work hard in order to give his son something good.  He wants his son to be able to study and become a professional, since he was not able to do so.  He also wants to have the chance to continue working with his father.

loans.use: to help his father buy two sacks of manure in order to fertilize his corn field again and to help pay the young man that assists his father.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 52 years old and married with six children. With one child in school, Nora works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

Nora has been in this business for 3 years.
