Es un padre ejemplar, siempre se ha esmerado por brindarle lo mejor a sus hijos, ciertamente no muchas comodidades económicas pero si se ha esforzado por brindarles una educación de calidad e inculcarles muchos valores.
Raul está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva por el apoyo que le han brindado, porque gracias a ello podrá realizar algunos arreglos a su vivienda como pintarrajear las paredes, reparar las ventanas y el techo. Gracias a ello podrá brindar a su familia un ambiente más seguro y más adelante podrá cumplir su más grande sueño: "Construir su casa de material noble".
texts.en:
Raul is a very hardworking man, he is 56 years old and lives in Parcona with his family. He has 3 children who are his greatest pride in life and a wife who he supports unconditionally. He has been selling animals for more than 20 years and it's going very well because he is very responsible, friendly and always gives the best of himself to obtain good results. He is an exemplary father, he has always ben careful about giving the best to his children, certainly not many economic comforts, but he has been strived provide them quality education and instill them with many values.

Raul is thankful to the Kiva lenders for the support they offer, because thanks to them he can make some repairs to his dwelling like painting the walls, repairing the windows and the roof. Thanks to them, he can offer his family a safer environment and in the future he will be able to reach his greatest dream: "To build a house of quality material".

loans.use: to repair the roof of his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system.

loans.name: Polly

texts.en:
Polly is a married woman and a mother of three children from Leyte, Philippines. Polly and her husband are engaged in a fishing business. This is the source of her income.

Polly's fishing business was ruined when a typhoon hit the country several months ago. Polly is asking for a loan to buy materials for the repair of the fishing boat like plywood, nails, paint, and epoxy. With this, they will be able to repair their fishing boat and then go back to their fishing business. In the future, Polly hope of making their fishing business a success.

loans.use: to buy materials for the repair of the fishing boat like plywood, nails, paint, and epoxy

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 45 years old and married with eight children. With four children in school, Cecilia works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Cecilia has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Cecilia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Jun

texts.en:
Jun is 35 years old and, alongside his wife, he makes a living growing rice in a rural community in the north of Philippines. 

This loan cycle, Jun is applying for financial support in order to buy fertilizers and manure that will allow him to look after his plants and have a good harvest.

This young man's enterprising and innovating spirit has allowed him to improve the quality and price of his harvest. By doing this, he has been able to increase his family's income.

Jun's dream is to expand his farm and to earn a higher income in order to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and manure that will allow him to look after his plants and have a good harvest.

loans.name: Jeralyn

texts.en:
Jeralyn is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Jeralyn is 54 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Jeralyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. Jeralyn requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Jeralyn has been in this business for 15 years. Jeralyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen, 29, is a smallholder farmer who lives in the Bosamaro Masaba area in Nyamira Division, Kenya. This area is renowned for being inhabited by a community whose staple food is bananas (locally known as Matoke). Hellen has been been practicing poultry farming for five years now. To make a decent living and take care of her two children, she has also ventured into a personal business besides holding a salary paying job.
 
Hellen is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. Of all the activities she is involved in, she enjoys poultry keeping the most. To her, poultry keeping started from being a way of life of an African homestead, to being a hobby, to being a business. With the loan, she seeks grow the business. 

However, it has been a rough ride for her finding a financier who would front money to a mere smallholder farmer without a substantial security or a bank statement showing regular source of income. 

Today, she is a member of Nyagwekonya Group. Through the group, she can access loans from Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance institution that was started to take care of smallholder's financial needs. Since joining, they have been trained to embrace saving money and group management to ensure cohesion and development.

Your loan will help Hellen to make more income that will enable her to pay for her children's education for a brighter future. The money will also enable her to take care of the basic needs of her family. When asked how she envisions life after successfully repaying the loan, Hellen replied, "Their (family) living standard will improve."

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Viviana Andrea

texts.es:
Viviana es una mujer pujante, servicial y trabajadora, a sus 28 años de edad, es casada y madre de 3 hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación.

Desde hace 4 años se desempeña en el campo de la confección, prestando el servicio de confección a terceros y a clientes directos, el oficio lo aprendió de manera empírica y trabaja con 2 operarias todos los días, así intenta generar los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.

Actualmente se motiva a solicitar el crédito para comprar 2 maquinas de dos agujas que le permitirán mejorar el nivel de producción de su taller para cumplir con la entrega oportuna de los pedidos que tiene pendientes, logrando fidelizar sus clientes actuales.

Viviana manifiesta que desea continuar realizando su labor con mucho empeño, pues quiere ampliar su negocio y poder generar oportunidades de empleo, además de garantizar una estabilidad económica para dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Viviana is a thriving, helpful and hardworking woman.  She is 28 years old, is married and mother of 3 children whom she has raised with great effort and dedication.

For 4 years, she has worked in the field of retail clothing, providing tailoring services to third parties and direct customers.  This trade she learned over time and she works with 2 helpers every day.  Thus she tries to generate sufficient resources to support her husband with the financial burden of the household.

Currently, she is applying for a loan  to buy two machines of dual needles to enhance the level of production of her workshop.  Thus she will meet timely delivery of orders, achieving loyalty of her current customers.

Viviana states that she wants to continue doing her work very hard. She wants to expand her business and generate employment opportunities, and ensure economic stability to give your family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase two machines of two needles for her workshop.

loans.name: Nurzada

texts.ru: Нурзаде 22 года, замужем, детей нет. У Нурзады - среднее образование, она знает, как правильно использовать и планировать денежные средства для достижения поставленных целей. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, Нурзада с 2010 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве имеется 1 теленок, 1 корова и 10 овец, также есть 1,80 ГА собственной земли, где Нурзада выращивает перец, картошку и клевер. Ежемесячный доход от реализации экологически чистых и вкусных овощей составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Нурзада обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений, селитры и обработку почвы. Нурзада является членом группы "Достук Жайылган", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека. Доходы от кредита Нурзада планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение своего бизнеса и хочет накопить средства на постройку сарая.
texts.en:
Nurzada is 22 and married with no children. She has a high school education and knows how to budget and save money to reach future goals. Since 2010, Nurzada has been working in animal husbandry and agriculture as the primary source of income for her family. She now has one calf, one cow and 10 sheep, as well as 1.8 hectares of her own land, where she grows peppers, potatoes and clover. Her monthly income from the sale of fresh and tasty vegetables is about 15,000 KGS. 

With the goal of further developing her business, Nurzada has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase fertilizers and to cultivate her land. She is a member of the "Dostuk Zhailgan" group, which consists of her and two other people. She plans to invest profits from the loan into further expanding her business and wants to save toward building a barn.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and cultivate the land to grow vegetables for sale

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe Benkadi 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Louganda, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec  Chatou , arrêtée au bout à droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir  1 hectare1. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 160 000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 1 group are married women who on average are 33 years old with three children, all living in traditional families in Louganda, one of the villages in Koutiala, the third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. This is their eighth loan with the institution, and past loans have been repaid in full.

The selected crop is groundnuts featuring Chatou, who is standing on the far right in the photo. She intends to use her loan to buy inputs, seeds, small agricultural equipment and pay for plowing and weeding to maintain 1.1 hectares (about 2.7 acres).

After harvest the crop will be sold at village level and in Koutiala, to a mixed clientele. She expects average profits of 160,000 CFA francs by season's end.

This profit will enable her to pay off her loan and also to help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: buy seeds, agricultural inputs, farming equipment, and pay for plowing and weeding

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system.

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe Benkadi 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Louganda, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide, Gombo et Maïs avec  Awa , assise au bout à droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 165 000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 1 group are married women who on average are 34 years old with three children, all living in traditional families in Louganda, one of the villages of Koutiala, in the third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. This is their eighth loan with the institution, and past loans have been repaid in full.

The selected crops are groundnuts, gombos and maize featuring Awa, who is kneeling at the far right in the photo. She intends to use her loan to buy inputs, seeds, small agricultural equipment and pay for plowing and weeding to maintain one hectare (about 2.4 acres).

After harvest the crop will be sold at village level and in Koutiala, to a mixed clientele. She expects average profits of 165,000 CFA francs by season's end.

This profit will enable her to pay off her loan and also to help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: buy seeds, agricultural inputs, farming equipment, and pay for plowing and weeding.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a cooler, fittings and decorations, purchase of work tools and purchase of assorted ice cream and shaved ice.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en: Nestor is a small producer from the northern part of Isabela, who has worked growing rice for over 8 years. In order to improve the nutrition of his plants in this loan cycle, he is asking for finance to buy the necessary manure and fertilizers. This will help him to achieve a good harvest and thereby a good income for his family. His dream is to improve his family's and his own living conditions, and in order to achieve this he works daily with great enthusiasm, confident that he will continue to grow and that in the future he will be able to earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy the necessary manure and fertilizers for his rice crop

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maria is 53 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Maria has a business selling ready-to-wear clothes in the Philippines. Maria requested a PHP 21,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more ready-to-wear clothes to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Maria has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more ready-to-wear clothes to sell

loans.name: Banco Mujer Creciendo Juntas Group

texts.es:
Wendy es la tesorera de Banco Mujer Creciendo Juntas, una mujer muy joven y emprendedora, con apenas 21 años,  tiene un niño pequeño, vive en unión libre y su compañero trabaja para una finca bananera como peón agrícola y recibe un salario muy bajo. A raíz de esto, ella decidió hace varios años iniciar su actividad en el área agrícola y a pequeña escala, esto le permite contribuir con los gastos básicos del hogar, así como pagarse sus estudios, ya que asiste por las noches a clases para terminar sus estudios de secundaria. Este es el tercer crédito que solicita a Fundación Mujer, los anteriores han sido de mucha ayuda para consolidar su producción, y está nueva inyección de capital es para la siembra de sandía, necesita de insumos como semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas y otros. 
Junto a ella integran el grupo 3 socias que van a invertir en actividades agropecuarias, como porcicultura, avicultura y agricultura.
texts.en:
Wendy is the treasurer of Bank Women Growing Together, a very enterprising young woman, just 21 years old.  She has a small child, and is living with a partner.  Her partner works for a banana farm as an agricultural laborer and receive very low wages.

Following this, she decided several years ago to start business in agriculture and small-scale. This allows her to help with basic household expenses and pay for his studies.  She attending classes at night to complete her high school studies.

This is the third loan requested by Woman Foundation. The preceding  have been very helpful to consolidate their production, and the new capital injection is to plant watermelon.  This requires inputs like seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and others.

Beside her, in the group are three members who will invest in agricultural activities, such as swine, poultry and agriculture.

loans.use: to purchase of supplies such as seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and others.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past fifteen years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Grace dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 50,000, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour and beans

loans.name: Mary Bessie

texts.en: Due to financial hardship, Mary Bessie aims to improve her small retail store to increase her gain and be able to sustain the necessities of her family and finance the education of her youngest child. She is 54 years old and has three children. To further improve the business, she would like to avail a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase more canned goods, noodles, seasonings, frozen foods, laundry soaps, snack foods, beverages and soft drinks to resell. She is hoping that this loan will help to make her business grow and become more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more canned goods, noodles, seasonings, frozen foods, soaps, snack foods, beverages and soft drinks to resell

loans.name: Emiliano

texts.es:
Emiliano es un hombre de 62 años de edad, casado, sin hijos y se dedica a la producción de queso artesanal.
Él es un hombre honesto, justo, sencillo, humilde y muy trabajador, su labor la realiza en la localidad de Batallas distante a 41 kilómetros de la ciudad de La Paz, cercano al lago Titicaca a una altura promedio de tres mil novecientos metros sobre el nivel del mar, la región tiene una temperatura cálida durante el día y muy fría durante la noche.
Emiliano es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro corto, sus manos son duras y arrugadas denotan el trabajo difícil del campo. Su negocio es la producción de queso artesanal, él elabora casi todo el material necesario para la elaboración de queso como; ollas de barro, recipientes de tallo de totora, cucharas de madera, tazas de barro, etc. Él necesita mejorar su producción para generar mejores ingresos económicos y mejorar su calidad de vida. Su negocio enfrenta problemas propios de la región como ser; el clima frío del lugar y la falta de forraje (pasto) dificultades que merman la producción de leche y por tanto la de queso también. Su sueño es mejorar su producción de queso para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
Es por esos motivos que Emiliano solicita un préstamo para la compra de vacas lecheras y con los beneficios mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Emiliano is a 62 year old man. He is married and without children and he is dedicated to the production of artesian cheese. He is an honest, fair, straightforward, humble and very hardworking man. He carries out his work in the locality of Batallas, a distance of 41 kilometers from the city of La Paz, close to Lake Titicaca at an average altitude of 3,900 meters above sea level. The region has a warm climate during the day and is very cold at night. 

Emiliano has dark skin, medium build, short black hair, and his hands are hard and lined, denoting his hard work in the field. His business is the production of artesian cheese; he makes almost all the necessary material for the creation of cheese such as clay pots, stem bulrush containers, wooden spoons, and clay mugs. 

He needs to improve his production in order to generate better economic income and to improve his quality of life. His business faces its own problems from the region as it is; the cold climate of the place and the lack of fodder. These are difficulties that impair the production of milk and therefore of the cheese as well. 

His dream is to improve his cheese production in order to give a better quality of life to himself and to his family. It is for these motives that Emiliano is requesting a loan for the purchase of milking cows, and with their benefits to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase milking cows, and with their benefits to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman with two kids, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family and school fees.

Joyce operates a grocery and vegetables selling stall; she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a wholesale business in the future. 

With the KES 50,000 she wants to pay school fees. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Reinerio

texts.es:
Reinerio tiene 41 años de edad, vive en el Distrito de Pucara, una comunidad de clima caluroso, es tranquila su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, está ubicada en la Provincia de Jaen que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Él brinda servicios de maestro de obra, realizando trabajos en obras civiles de construcción, realizando esta actividad desde hace 15 años, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para la compra de madera para construcción y de esta manera generar ingresos adicionales para una mejor calidad de vida de él y de su familia.
texts.en:
Reinerio is 41 years old and lives in the District of Pucara, a peaceful community with a warm climate. The people engage in agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding. This area is located in Jaen Province, which is part of the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru.

Reinerio offers his services as a master builder. He undertakes construction projects and has been in this business for 15 years. Reinerio is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1,000 PEN so that he can buy wood for construction. This will help him to generate additional income so that he can improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy wood for his construction business.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lilibeth is 52 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Lilibeth has a business buying and selling dry goods business in the Philippines. Lilibeth requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks of dry goods to sell to her customers.

Lilibeth has been in this business for 3 years. Lilibeth would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of dry goods to sell to her customers

loans.name: Maria Criste

texts.en:
Maria Criste is single and has a business selling cellular phones and accessories in the Philippines.

Maria Criste requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional cellular phones and accessories to sell.

Maria Criste has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Maria Criste would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional cellular phones and accessories to sell

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a mother of six children, all of whom attend school. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her business. Fatuma dreams of establishing a hotel in the future. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase 3 bundles of wheat flour, cooking oil and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 3 bundles of wheat flour, cooking oil and sugar

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 34 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Adelaida is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Adelaida has been in this business for two years and also earns additional income from vegetable vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anabel Rosario

texts.es:
Anabel es una joven soltera, tiene 19 años de edad y vive en Ica junto a su familia.
Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante y muy emprendedora. Desde hace más de 1 año trabaja como ayudante de Cocina en un Restaurante, asimismo cuida a un niño por las mañanas y como toda una próspera empresaria está innovando en el negocio de venta de calzados. A su corta edad es una persona que a pesar de algunas adversidades en su hogar ha sabido enfrentar estos retos y se está superando.
Anabel quiere ampliar su negocio de venta de calzados y para ello necesita comprar mercadería para poder ofrecer variedad de productos a los clientes. Ella está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar más zapatos para el negocio y así poder incrementar sus ventas. Gracias a ello podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y seguirá esforzándose para poder "Ampliar su negocio".
texts.en:
Anabel is an unmarried girl. She is 19 years old and lives in Ica with his family.  She is a person eager to get ahead and very enterprising. For more than 1 year she has been working as an assistant at a Restaurant Kitchen also cares for a child in the morning. As a whole, she is innovating a successful selling of shoes.

At a young age,  she is a person who despite some adversity in her home has been able to face these challenges and has overcome.  Anabel wants to expand her business selling shoes and buy goods it needs in order to offer variety of products to customers.

She is grateful to Kiva lenders for the support they have given. This she may buy more shoes for the business and increase sales. Thanks to this, she can improve the quality of life of her family and will continue to strive to "Expand Her Business".

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her business selling shoes.

loans.name: Resty

texts.en: Resty, 40 years old, is married and blessed with three kids. He has been engaged in the farming business for 20 years. He is a very kind person. He always sustains the needs of his family. He loves to serve other people. To have additional income he is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 13,000 to buy manure, fertilizer and seeds to grow for his farm business. Resty hopes that his business will expand so that he can fill all the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer and seeds to grow for his farm business

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is married with three children. She is 32 years old and lives in Lahore. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has five years' experience. He is the sole income earner in the family. The income raised from driving the rickshaw only covers their monthly expenses, which leaves them with no savings. He needs to provide proper servicing to his rickshaw from time to time. Now he wants some maintenance for his rickshaw but due to a shortage of funds he is unable to do so. 
As a dedicated wife Salma wants to help her husband therefore she has requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, a Kiva partner. They are hopeful of a better future for their family and their dream is provide a better education for their children.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Lyndelou

texts.en:
Lyndelou is 37 years old and married with one child.

Lyndelou works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Lyndelou has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from her manicure weaving business.

Lyndelou aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Somos Impacto 2006 Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Somos Impacto 2006” está conformada por 08 socios responsables y trabajadores. Este es el caso de Dina de 73 años separada con 10 hijos independientes. Hace 06 años que se dedica a la venta de anticuchos y golosinas. Su mayor deseo es poner una tienda de abarrotes en su local propio. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de carne de res y pollo. Con mucho esfuerzo a logrado darles una mejor educación a sus hijos lo cual se siente orgullosa. El grupo “Somos Impacto 2006” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por facilitarle este crédito. Dina se encuentra de pie en la parte posterior y es la cuarta del lado izquierdo y viste chompa negro.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Somos Impacto 2006” consists of eight responsible and hardworking members. Such is the case with Dina, who is 73 years old, separated from her spouse, and has 10 children who are independent. For the past six years, she has been selling grilled meats and snacks. Her greatest wish is to have her own place where she can set up a grocery store. Her most recent loan will be used to buy beef and chicken. With great effort she was able to provide for her children’s education, an accomplishment of which she is proud.

The group “Somos Impacto 2006” appreciates the Kiva lenders for facilitating this loan. In the photo, Dina is standing at the back on the left side and wearing a black sweater.

loans.use: to buy beef and chicken.

loans.name: Brayan Alexander

texts.es:
Brayan es un joven de 21 años de edad que encontró en la venta de productos de la marca Amway como la manera para generar buenos ingresos estando cerca  de su familia y aportando con los gastos en su hogar. 

Es un joven muy aplicado y estudioso, actualmente está cursando una carrera universitaria y con este trabajo se ha podido sostener con su transporte y gastos de estudio.

El solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos de esta reconocida marca al por mayor y poder fortalecer sus inventarios mejorando a si sus ventas.

Tiene toda la energía para trabajar y tiene muy buenas ideas para su negocio.

Apoya con un préstamo a este joven emprendedor para que pueda salir adelante con sus estudios!
texts.en:
Brayan, age 21, is a young man who sells Amway products in order to generate a good income. He is close to his family and helps with the household expenses.

This young man is very diligent and studious. He is currently studying for a university degree, so his work enables him to pay for his transportation and educational expenses. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy products from this known brand in bulk so that he can strengthen his inventory and improve his sales. He has all the energy he needs to do his work. In addition, he has very good ideas for his business.

Support his young entrepreneur with a loan so that he can move forward with his studies!

loans.use: to buy Amway products in bulk that he can sell.

loans.name: G.s Rio Group

texts.es:
El señor Francisco se dedica al comercio de combustible y refrescos, tiene  casa propia y dos  hijos  que  dependen de el, vive en una comunidad de Trojes  al oriente de Honduras.
Don Francisco esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de una planta solar porque en el municipio donde viven no poseen el servicio de energía eléctrica, espera que esta inversión le sea de mucha ayuda y le permita mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia, también espera poder contribuir al medio ambiente haciendo uso de energía renovable.
Doña Maricela se dedica a la venta de abarrotería en general desde varios años.
Doña María se dedica al comercio de abarrotería.
Don Saúl Edgardo se dedica al Trasporte.


Trojes, Honduras- 30 de Julio del 2014.
texts.en:
Sr. Francisco has a business of selling fuel and soft drinks. He owns a house and has two children who are dependent on him. Don Francisco lives in a community in Trojes, which is in eastern Honduras. He is requesting a loan so that he can buy a solar energy system because the town where he lives does not receive electricity service. Francisco hopes this investment will be of great help and improve a little his quality of life and that of his family. He also hopes to contribute to the environment by using renewable energy.

Doña Maricela has been selling groceries for several years.

Doña María is also in the grocery business.

Don Saúl Edgardo is in the transportation business.

Trojes, Honduras – July 30, 2014

loans.use: to buy a solar energy system for his home.

loans.name: Soro Yiriwa 1 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SORO YIRIWA 1 est constitué de 8 hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et 7 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles polygames à KOUEN, un des villages de BOUGOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles hivernale. 
Ils sont à leur  1er prêt avec l’institution.
Le  maïs est la spéculation cultivée de BROULAYE, le 1er homme assis dans la photo de la droite vers la gauche.
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter des intrants, la semence, payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour exploiter  2 hectares. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village, au marché, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 300.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et  de gérer les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Soro Yiriwa 1 group consists of eight married men who on average are 40 years old with seven children, all living in polygamous families in Kouen, one of the villages of Bougouni, in the third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their winter farming activities. They are on their first loan with the institution.

The selected crop is maize featuring Broulaye, the first man sitting from right to left in the photo. He intends to use his loan to buy inputs and seeds, and pay for plowing and weeding to maintain two hectares (about 5 acres).

After harvest the crop will be sold at the village market to a clientele composed of men and women. He expects profits of 300,000 CFA francs per growing season.

This profit will enable him to repay the loan and manage the family's daily expenses.

loans.use: buy inputs and seeds, and pay for plowing and weeding

loans.name: Richard Moises

texts.es:
Richard Moises tiene 26 años de edad, vive en el caserio de Lishinas del distrito de Pucara, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaen que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Él brinda servicios de transporte en mototaxi, realizando esta actividad desde hace 5 años, adicionalmente se dedica a brindar servicios como peón agricola, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 800 nuevos soles para invertir en arreglos de su mototaxi y de esta manera generar ingresos adicionales para mejorar calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Richard Moises is 26 years old and lives in the village of Lishinas in the District of Pucara, a community with a warm climate. The people engage in agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding. This area is located in Jaen Province, which is part of the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru.

Richard provides transportation services with his motorcycle taxi. He has been in this business for five years. In addition, he offers his services as a farm laborer. Richard is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 800 PEN so that he can invest in repairs to his motorcycle taxi. This will help him to generate additional income so that he can improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for repairs to his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Jorge Ivan

texts.es:
El señor Jorge tiene gran experiencia en el área de los alimentos, hace algún tiempo inicio con su propia cafetería y manifiesta sentirse muy feliz con ella.

Siempre ha preferido trabajar independiente, trabaja todos los días desde las 6:00 Am hasta las 9:00 Pm.

Actualmente necesita un auxilio económico para realizar la compra de un enfriador y una vitrina para exhibir y proteger los productos alimenticios que vende.

El préstamo le permitirá trabajar en unas mejores condiciones y podrá garantizar la calidad de sus productos ya que tendrá todos los elementos para su conservación.

Su mayor sueño es poder tener una gran cafetería y restaurante con gran flujo de clientes.

Con esta ayuda podrá trabajar de una manera más organizada y podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia a través de este préstamo.
texts.en:
Sr. Jorge has a great deal of experience in the food industry. Some time ago, he opened his own cafeteria and says that he is very happy with it. Jorge has always preferred to work independently. He works every day from 6:00 A.M. to 9:00 P.M.

He currently needs financial assistance so that he can buy a cooler and a display case in order to exhibit and protect the food that he sells. The loan will allow him to work under better conditions and also guarantee the quality of his products since all of the ingredients will be preserved.

His greatest wish is to have a successful cafeteria and restaurant with a large influx of customers. Having this assistance will help him to work in a more organized manner. In addition, this loan will help to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a cooler and a display case.

loans.name: Soro Yiriwa 2 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SORO YIRIWA 2 est constitué de 7 hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et 6 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles polygames à KOUEN, un des villages de BOUGOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles hivernale. 
Ils sont à leur  1er prêt avec l’institution.
Le  maïs est la spéculation cultivée de ADAMA, le 2ème homme debout  dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite.
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter des intrants, la semence, payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour exploiter  2 hectares. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village, au marché, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 350.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et  de gérer les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Soro Yiriwa 2 group consists of seven married men who on average are 35 years old with six children, all living in polygamous families in Kouen, one of the villages of Bougouni, in the third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their winter farming activities. They are on their first loan with the institution.

The selected crop is maize featuring Adama, the second man standing from left to right in the photo. He intends to use his loan to buy inputs and seeds, and pay for plowing and weeding to maintain two hectares (about 5 acres).

After harvest the crop will be sold at the village market to a clientele composed of men and women. He expects profits of 350,000 CFA francs per growing season.

This profit will enable him to repay the loan and manage the family's daily expenses.

loans.use: buy inputs and seeds, and pay for plowing and weeding.

loans.name: Reina De La Paz

texts.es:
Reina de 45 años de edad, estudio hasta 3º grado, está casada; su esposo es agricultor. Tienen 2 hijos que ya no dependen directamente de ella. 

Reina tiene un molino de combustible, en donde los habitantes de la comunidad llegan donde ella a moler desde hace 7 años aproximadamente. El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar abono, fertilizantes para los cultivos de maíz que realiza su esposo y mejoramiento del molino (repuestos). Ella sueña que su molino sea la parte fundamental generadora de sus ingresos y hacer crecer el negocio para el sustento de la familia.
texts.en:
Reina is 45 years old and has a third grade education. Reina is married; her husband is a farmer. The couple has two children who no longer depend on their mother.

Reina has a petrol-operated grinder where locals have been coming to grind goods for around seven years. This loan from "CrediCampo" will be used to buy manure and fertilisers to help her husband's corn crops; and to buy spare parts for her corn grinder.

Reina dreams that her grinder will become a main source of income and that the business will expand so that she can support her family.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilisers to help her husband's corn crops; and to buy spare parts for her corn grinder.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilisers, chemical, bags and box for packing crops.

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es:
El señor Victor es un veterano de mil batallas vividas a lo largo de su vida, vive en el municipio de Medellín con su esposa y su bebe.

El es un hombre muy trabajador y desde hace algún tiempo viene trabajando en el negocio de la venta de productos de la marca Omnilife, que son productos para el cuidado personal. 

Su negocio consiste en la compra y venta de estos productos a través de catalogo. 

El ofrece sus productos de manera ambulante y cuando un cliente le hace un pedido inmediatamente trata de cumplirlo.

Es por esto que solicita un crédito para la compra de estos productos al por mayor, de esta forma tendrá mercancía siempre disponible para sus clientes.

Manifiesta que es un negocio muy bueno y sencillo de realizar para él y con el cual ha intentado sostener a su familia de la mejor manera posible.

El préstamo le dará la oportunidad de capitalizar su negocio y de darle un impulso considerable a su actividad, permitiéndole obtener recursos para el cuidado y protección de su hijo.

Con tu apoyo podrás impulsar el negocio de Victor, Haz un préstamo!
texts.en:
Victor is the veteran of 1000 life battles. He lives in the municipality of Medellin with his wife and baby.

Victor is very hard-working and, for some time, he has had a business selling Omnilife products, which are personal care goods.

Victor's business consists of buying and selling Omnilife products through a catalogue.

Victor sells his goods as a street vendor. Whenever a customer makes an order, he immediately tries to fulfill it.

It is for this reason that Victor is applying for this loan. He will use it to buy Omnilife products in bulk. He will therefore always have merchandise available for his customers.

Victor says that he has a very good and simple business. With it, he has tried to support his family as best as possible.

This loan will give Victor the opportunity to capitalise on his business and give it a big push forward. This will allow him to earn an income to look after and protect his son.

You can support and drive forward Victor's business. Make a loan!

loans.use: to buy Omnilife products to strengthen his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar power system for her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groceries, supplies and staple goods; to buy displays and stands for his products; and to buy a fridge and freezer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar power system for his home.

loans.name: Mileidy Patricia

texts.es:
Mileidy es una mujer muy emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y progresar.

Desde hace 4 años se viene dedicando a la venta de productos por catalogo como ropa, accesorios, artículos de belleza y elementos para el hogar, estos productos los vende principalmente a amigos, vecinos y familiares. 

Desde siempre ha sentido gran gusto por el comercio y las ventas, por lo que hoy en día tiene grandes habilidades en este campo gracias a su simpatía y excelente calidad de servicio.

Adicionalmente siente la necesidad de trabajar para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia que han tenido que soportar grandes obstáculos.

Solicita un préstamo para comprar un vitrina y poder tener sus productos bien organizados exhibidos en su casa, adicionalmente compra surtido de productos de belleza y ropa para mejorar sus ventas y aumentar su capital.

Esto le permitirá atender a sus clientes de una mejor manera y aumentara sus ventas de una manera significativa.

Tiene la esperanza de poder salir adelante gracias al apoyo de las personas de buen corazón que apoyan este tipo de proyectos.

Apoya tu también a esta emprendedora!
texts.en:
Mileidy is an enterprising woman with a lot of desire to get ahead and make progress.

For four years she has been working in catalogue sales of clothing, accessories, beauty products and household items, she sells these products mainly to friends, neighbors and family members.

She has always had a great love for business and sales, so now she has great ability in this field thanks to her kindness and the excellent quality of her services.

Also she feels the need to work in order to improve the living conditions of her family who she has had to support over great obstacles.

She is requesting a loan to buy a display case and be able to have her products well organized to show in her home. She also will buy assorted beauty products and clothing to improve her sales and increase her capital.

This will enable her to serve her clients better and increase her sales significantly.

She hopes to be able to get ahead thanks to the support of the people with good hearts who support these kinds of projects.

You too can support this entrepreneur!

loans.use: to purchase a display case and assorted beauty products and clothing for her business.

loans.name: María Elba

texts.es:
María de 63 años de edad, no tiene grado de estudio, esta soltera. Vive sola, no tiene hijos. Ella se dedica a los oficios varios domésticos, ayuda hacer tortillas, pupusas, lavar, etc. 

María solicita el préstamo a CREDICAMPO,  para comprar una plancha y maíz para iniciar con una venta de tortillas propia. 

Ella planea poder ahorrar y dejarle a sus nietos dinero para que puedan estudiar.
texts.en:
Maria is 63 years old, she didn't complete school and is single. She lives alone, she does not have children. She works in various domestic trades, she helps making tortillas, pupusas, washing, etc.

Maria is requesting a loan from CREDICAMPO, to buy a griddle and corn to start selling her own tortillas.

She plans to save and leave money so her descendants can study.

loans.use: to buy a griddle and corn to start her own tortilla sales.

loans.name: Wend-Panga Lougvisse Grand Groupe

texts.fr:
Mme RASMATA représente le groupe WEND-PANGA LOUGVISSE GRAND GROUPE. Mariée, elle est mère de 06enfants. Le plus âgé a 19ans et le moins âgé a 03ans. 05 vont à l’école et elle a 05personnes en charge.
Mme fait le jardinage depuis plus de 30ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants.
Elle veut s’acheter ½ kg de semence d’oignon, ½ kg de semence de tomate, 01 sac d’engrais et 02 boites d’insecticides.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut résoudre ses petits problèmes familiaux. Elle ambitionne agrandir son activité et mieux s’occuper de ses enfants car maintenant on ne compte plus sur le mari seulement.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rasmata represents the Wend-Panga Lougvisse Grand Group. She is married with six children. The oldest is 19 and the youngest is three. Five of the children go to school and she has five people dependent on her.
Mrs. Rasmata has been a gardener for 30 years. She buys her stock in neighbouring villages.
She would like to buy ½ kg of onion seeds, ½ kg of tomato seeds, one sack of fertiliser and two boxes of insecticide.
With her profits, she hopes to solve some little family problems. Her goal is to expand her business and take better care of her children, for now she can no longer count only on her husband.

loans.use: to buy ½ kg of onion seeds, ½ kg of tomato seeds, 1 sack of fertiliser and 2 boxes of insecticide.

loans.name: Olga Irene

texts.es:
Olga es una mujer pujante, servicial y trabajadora, a sus 42 años de edad, es casada y madre de dos hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación.

Desde hace 15 años se desempeña en el campo de la confección, prestando el servicio de confección a terceros y a clientes directos, el oficio lo aprendió de manera empírica y trabaja sola todos los días, así genera los recursos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.

Actualmente se motiva a solicitar el crédito para comprar insumos al por mayor (telas, hilos, resorte, entre otros) esto le permitirá tener material disponible para cumplir con la entrega oportuna de los pedidos que tiene pendientes, logrando fidelizar sus clientes actuales.

Olga manifiesta que desea continuar realizando su labor con mucho empeño, pues quiere ampliar su negocio y poder generar oportunidades de empleo, además de garantizar una estabilidad económica para dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Olga is a vigorous, helpful and hardworking woman, at 42 years old, she is married and the mother of two children who she has brought up with great effort and dedication.

15 years ago she started working in the field of tailoring, offering her tailoring services to third parties and directly to clients, she learnt this trade through experience and works alone every day, in this way she generates income to support her husband with the economic burden of the home.

Currently she is motivated to request a loan to buy wholesale supplies (fabric, thread, elastic, etc.) which will enable her to have materials available in her workshop in order to promptly deliver pending orders, achieving the loyalty of her current customers.

Olga says that she wishes to continue working very hard, as she wants to expand her business and generate employment opportunities, and ensure economic stability to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy dressmaking supplies such as fabric, thread, needles, lace, buttons, etc., to supply her workshop.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.en: Basilia is a 56 year old married woman from Leyte, Philippines. She is engaged in the hog raising business and has been in the business for more than two years now. This is her main source of income. Several months ago, a typhoon hit the country and ruined most livelihood including Basilia's business. Basilia has just started again and is in need of additional capital for her business. She is requesting a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed and supplement. With this, she will be able to expand her hog raising business thus augmenting her profit.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed and supplement

loans.name: Mwanaiki

texts.en:
Mwanaiki is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour for her retail shop

loans.name: Sol

texts.en:
Sol is 45 years old and has three children.  Sol is married and all of her children are in school.

Sol is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Sol requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Sol has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed eleven times in the past from NWTF.

In the future, Sol would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Tabitha, a 63 year old wife and mother of 5 lovely children that she really treasures and values. She hails from the Nyamira area of Kenya, an area with perfect weather conditions to support agriculture and also is referred to as a banana growing region. She has been farming for the past 35 years in her small parcel of land and her primary source of income has been milk, tea and some personal business that she does to make ends meet. Tabitha is a very enterprising and a visionary woman who is seeking kindly for funds to expand into poultry farming on her farm.
Poultry farming is one of the profitable business ventures in Kenya and you don’t have to do it in large scale in order to benefit from the business, you can start small. Having a keen eye has helped Tabitha notice a ready market for poultry and wants to take full advantage of that and Improve her income. Although she wants to make her dream a reality, she lacks the finances. This is because accessing funds as a woman in Africa is very difficult, but Tabitha hopes that through your support she will achieve her dream.
Through the loan Tabitha will be able to reap more profits because the demand for chicken is always high being such a popular meal for many people. Tabitha will benefit from selling eggs, meat and also feathers from her poultry and all this will assure her of improved living conditions and assure her children of a secured future.
Through partners such as Juhudi kilimo via Kiva lenders, Tabitha feels relieved knowing that her ultimate goal of transforming her life will be achieved. Profits from selling eggs, meat and feathers to fast-food joints and nearby market will be used in repaying back the loan and securing the future of her children and grandchildren.

loans.use: To start poultry farming

loans.name: G.s. Shalom Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario Shalom, esta conformado por tres integrantes Paula Vicenta, Maria Jose y Santos Eradios, todos soltero y comerciantes, con nueve hijos todos mayores de edad, se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables y con muchos deseos de superación persona, estos integrantes de este grupo se conocen porque son de la misma zona por lo tanto decidieron optar al crédito bajo la modalidad de grupo solidario para ayudarse económicamente e invertir en sus diferentes negocio. son originarios de una comarca de uno de los municipios de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, zona que se caracteriza por ser productivamente comercial, y donde existe uno de los ingenios mas grande del país,donde se produce la azúcar, donde trabajan en diferentes negocios, y es la forma de vida que tienen para poder mantener a su familia, ya que por falta de recursos económicos no logran terminar sus estudios aprendiendo lo mas necesario que es saber leer y escribir debido a que venían de familias con bajos recursos económicos, a parte de eso que son comunidades rurales y no prestan las condiciones para estudios ya que estos quedan bastante alejados, Paula Vicenta quien es la coordinadora la cual se encarga de las responsabilidad y cumplimiento de pagos en tiempo y forma es administradora y propietaria  de un taller de ebanistería y venta de tortillas, leche agria, cuajadas,cereales, pinolillos y pinol, cacao, canela entre otros mas,  actividades que las realiza en su casa de habitación y cerca de uno de los mercados de otra localidad, sus compras son al contado tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, negocios el cual tiene ya mas de seis años iniciando con fondos propios con siete libras de maíz, pero al ver que su demanda fue creciendo fue produciendo mas hasta llegar a trabajar con 50 libras de maíz, al mismo tiempo inicio vendiendo cuajadas, leche agria, al igual que elabora todo tipo de muebles como: ropero, camas, sillas mecedoras, gabeteros, puertas entre otros mas, este negocio le dedica 6 días a la semana y solamente por la mañana ya que por las tardes mira su otro negocio, gracias al buen servicio que ha tenido con sus clientes es la forma que ha podido mantenerlos e ir creciendo poco a poco en el mercado con sus clientes fijos, uno de sus sueños es poder seguir creciendo mas en su negocio para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mayores ingresos económicos, por lo tanto el G.S. Shalom esta solicitando un financiamiento para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de productos de materia prima, para la elaboración de tortillas, como: maíz, leña, leche, cal, entre otros productos  mas.-
texts.en:
The solidarity group 'Shalom' is made up of three members: Paula Vicenta, Maria Jose and Santos Eradios.  They are all single and are traders.  Between them, they have nine children who are all of adult age. 

They are hard-working, responsible people who are always looking to improve.  They know each other because they are from the same area.  For this reason, they decided to get together and ask for a loan as a group, gaining financial support and being able to invest in their different business ventures.
 
They come from an area in one of the municipalities of Chinandega, which is located in the western part of the country.  It is famous for its trade, and boasts one of the largest sugar mills in the country.  The members work in different lines of work.  This is their way of life as they seek to support their families.  

They weren't able to finish their studies because of financial difficulties.  They were only able to learn the basic things such as to read and write; things which they learnt from their families.  Apart from the poverty, the rural area they live in doesn't offer any educational facilities.  The only ones on offer are quite a way away. 

Paula Vicenta is the coordinator of the group who takes care of making the payments on time.  She is also the owner of a woodwork workshop and in addition, she sells tortillas, milk, curd, cereal, pinol and cornmeal, cocoa, cinnamon and other things.  She does all these things from home and also operates near one of the markets in a local town.

She trades in cash and has fixed and occasional customers.  She has been doing these activities for more than six years now.  She started up using her own funds, and began by producing seven pounds of corn.  When she saw that demand was increasing, she started to produce more, reaching up to 50 pounds of corn. 

At the same time, she starting selling curds and sour milk; all the while making all kinds of furniture such as wardrobes, beds, rocking chairs, cabinets, doors and many other things. 

She dedicates six days a week to her business; working in the morning on one thing and then in the afternoon on another.  Thanks to the good service she offers, she has been able to keep hold of her customers and establish herself more and more in the market with new ones.   

One of her dreams is to keep expanding in her business so that she can generate more income in the near future.   For this reason, the group 'Shalom' is asking for a loan to invest in buying raw materials, some such as corn, milk, limestone for making tortillas, and other products for their other lines of work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make tortillas, and to buy wood for furniture.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 46 years old and married with five children.  With four children in school, Ofelia works very hard to provide for them.

Ofelia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ofelia has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, noodles, rice and other groceries. 

In the future, Ofelia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gloria Angely

texts.es:
Gloria, a sus 29 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y pujante; pues siempre va en busca de alternativas que le permitan progresar. 

Desde hace muchos años se dedica a trabajar en el campo de la confección, el oficio lo aprendió de manera empírica, poco a poco fue perfeccionando su técnica y ampliando sus conocimientos por medio de la práctica, esto la impulsó para iniciar su propio taller, para lo cual adecuó un espacio en la casa donde reside y, con unos ahorros que tenía compró sus primeras máquinas.
 
Trabaja sola todos los días, pero en ocasiones recibe el apoyo de una persona, dependiendo de la cantidad de contratos que tenga; así ha logrado generar recursos para solventar los gastos del hogar. 

El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para el fortalecimiento de su labor, pues con el dinero comprará insumos para confección como tela, hilos, agujas, encajes, botones, entre otros, para abastecer su taller y también adecuara el espacio donde tiene sus maquinas para trabajar de una manera mas cómoda, de esta forma podrá agilizar el proceso de producción y adquirir más contratos, generando mayor rentabilidad en el negocio. 

Gloria manifiesta que su mayor desafío es la competencia en el mercado, sin embargo esto la sigue motivando para seguir prestando un mejor servicio y luchar para que el sueño de la acreditación de su negocio se haga realidad y le permita generar oportunidades de empleo, así mejorará su calidad de vida y la de las personas que influyan en la labor.
texts.en:
Gloria, 29, is a hard-working and determined woman.  She is always looking for ways to get ahead. 

For a long time she has been working in clothing.  She learnt this trade through experience.  Little by little she has improved her skills and expanded her knowledge by practising.  This led to her opening her own workshop.  To do this she set up a space in her home, using some savings that she had to buy her first machines.
 
She works alone every day, but from time to time she gets help from somebody depending on the amount of orders that she has.  Working in this way, she has managed to generate some income to take care of household expenses. 

The loan she is asking for is to strengthen her business.  With the money she will buy supplies for her clothes making such as cloth, thread, needles, lace, buttons and other things to stock her workshop.  She will also open up a space where she can put her machines so she can work in more comfort.  This will all help her speed up her production process and get more orders, making her business more profitable. 

She says that her main challenge is the competition in the market.  However, this only motivates her to keep offering a fantastic service and strive for her business to be officially accredited.  This will then allow her to employ other people, improving her quality of life and that of those who influence her work.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making clothes and to make improvements to her workshop.

loans.name: Elsy Martínez

texts.es:
Elsy de 40 años de edad, estudio hasta 6º grado, está casada, su esposo está en EEUU, tiene 13 años de vivir allá, tiene 2 hijos los cuales ya estudian. 

Ella se dedica a los oficios domésticos, ya que depende de la ayuda de su esposo. Antes era comerciante, vendía verduras en el mercado de la ciudad. El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar ladrillos, cemento, arena, tejas y gastos personales, para mejorar su vivienda. Ella planea darle el estudio necesario a sus dos hijos, para que puedan defenderse en el futuro.
texts.en:
Elsy, 40, studied until 6th grade.  She is married.  Her husband has been living in the USA for 13 years.  She has two children who are both studying. 

She takes care of the housework, as she is dependent on her husband. She used to be a trader, selling vegetables in the local city market. 

She will use the loan to buy bricks, cement, sand, tiles and take care of personal expenses in order to improve her home. 

Her objective in life is to offer her children a good education so they can get along in the future.

loans.use: to buy building materials to improve her home.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
A sus 45 años de edad Nelly es una de las principales vendedoras porcicultoras de la zona con una gran responsabilidad de surtir a varias tiendas, carnicerías y personas del sector y zonas cercanas a su finca, y sabe que siempre tiene que tener existencias para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.

Quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de más de 40 cerdos y realizar adecuaciones a sus cocheras. 

El crédito será muy importante pues con el podrá tener su flujo de venta de normal y retener sus clientes para evitar que se vayan a otras fincas y que ella pueda seguir creciendo la finca y seguir prosperando con sus hijos.
texts.en:
At 45 years of age, Nelly is one of the main pig farmers in the area and is responsible for supplying many stores, butchers and customers in her area and nearby.  She knows the importance of having enough produce to satisfy the needs of her customers.

She wants to ask for a loan to buy more than 40 pigs; and also to make some improvements to her pig stys. 

The loan will be very important because she can maintain her normal level of sales and keep hold of her customers.  Otherwise, they would go to other farms.  

She will also be able to expand her farm and continue to thrive with her children.

loans.use: to buy 40 pigs and make improvements to her pig sty.

loans.name: Lelis Ibeth

texts.es: Lelis, tiene 46 años de edad, está casada, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su esposo e hijos en el municipio de Olanchito, Yoro. Tiene su propio negocio donde vende productos de abarrotería, como ser arroz, azúcar, refrescos, carnes, jabón, churros, harina, agua en botellas, cilindros de gas LPG y otros productos de la canasta básica. Este negocio lo tiene hace 9 años y 8 meses, lo tiene ubicado en su casa y es su fuente de ingresos.  El préstamo es de 10,000 lempiras, este dinero lo invertirá en la compra de  productos básicos como carnes, refrescos, azúcar, arroz, harina, churros y otros para surtir el negocio y tener más clientes. tiene como meta salir adelante con su negocio y familia.
texts.en:
Lelis, 46, is married and has two children.  She lives with her husband and children in Olanchito, Yoro. 

She has her own business where she sells groceries such  as rice, sugar, soft drinks, meat, soap, churros, flour, bottled water, butane gas and other basic household items.  She has had the business for nine years and eight months.  She runs it from her house and it is her source of income.  

The loan is for 10,000 lempiras which she will invest in basic products such as meat, soft drinks, sugar, rice, churros and other items necessary to stock her store.  This will help her to attract more customers.  

Her goal in life is to succeed in her professional and family life.

loans.use: to buy products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Meerim

texts.ru: Мээрим 28 лет, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей. У Мээрим среднее образование, с 2003 года она стала заниматься сельским хозяйством, в качестве стартового капитала у нее было всего 5,000 сомов (KGS). Сегодня в хозяйстве Мээрим есть 2 дойные коровы и 2 теленка, полученное молоко она реализует местным жителям, так как молоко экологически чистое и вкусное, оно пользуется большим спросом. Также у Мээрим есть земельный надел мерою 1,20 ГА, где она выращивает картошку, фасоль и многолетние травы, реализуя овощи на местном рынке и заготавливая сено для скота. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 12,000 сомов (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Мээрим обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений и селитры. Мээрим является одним из трех участников группы "Достук Жайылган". Доходы от полеводческой деятельности позволят Мээрим купить бытовую технику для дома, а также увеличить число дойных коров.
texts.en:
Meerim is 28 years old, married and raising three children. Meerim has secondary education. She has been working with agriculture since 2003. She only had 5,000 som (KGS) as starting capital. Currently Meerim has two dairy cows and two calves at her farm. She sells the milk to the local residents. As organic milk is very tasty, it is in high demand. Meerim also has a plot of land of 1.20 hectares, where she grows potatoes, beans and perennial grasses. She sells the vegetables at the local market and uses the hay for the cattle. The monthly income is around 12,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Meerim turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 20,000 som (KGS) to purchase fertilizers and nitrate. Meerim is one of three members of the group "Dostuk Zhaiylgan". The income from her farming enables Meerim to purchase household appliances for her home, and also to increase the number of dairy cows.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and nitre for growing organic vegetables

loans.name: Farida

texts.ru: Фарида добросовестная жизнерадостная женщина. Она замужем и имеет 5 детей. Ее муж пенсионер. Фарида имеет высшее педагогическое образование. Она работает более 30 лет в средней школе. Фарида имеет большого опыта в сфере преподавания. Фарида несколько лет назад врачи сделали операцию головы. Теперь она ежегодно должна лечиться. Фарида получает маленькую зарплату и это зарплата не хватает для лечения. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 6000 сомони для покупки лекарства для лечения. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Farida is a conscientious and cheerful woman. She is married and has five children. Her husband is retired. Farida has higher education in teaching. She has worked at a high school for more than 30 years. Farida has long experience in the field of teaching. 

A few years ago, Farida had surgery to her head. Currently she needs to be treated every year. Farida receives a small pay and this pay is not enough for the medicine. She requests a loan in the amount of 6,000 somoni to purchase medicine for treatment. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy medicines for treatment

loans.name: Jamila

texts.ru: Этой молодой женщине по имени Чамила 28 лет. Она живет в одном из сел района Кубадиён с двумя маленькими детьми. Муж в настоящее время находится в России, который как многие мужчины его страны уехал туда, чтобы зарабатывать и обеспечивать свою семью питанием и одеждой. Сама Чамила занимается торговлей. Она ходит к местным дехканам, закупает у них оптом миндаль и затем продает его на рынках своего района. Такой деятельностью она занимается уже 2 года. Ее научили этому виду торговли ее родители, которые видели как жизнь дочери с финансовой стороны тяжела. Сейчас Чамиле не хватает финансов, чтобы закупить партию миндаля для перепродажи. Она очень надеется на вашу финансовую поддержку, чтобы продолжить свою торговую деятельность. Поддержите ее.
texts.en:
This young woman, called Jamila, is 28 years old. She lives in one of the villages in the Qubadiyon region with her two small children. Her husband is currently in Russia. Like many men of her country, he went there to earn money and provide his family with food and clothing. 

Jamila works with retail. She goes to the local dekhan farmers, purchases almonds wholesale from them, and then sells them at the markets of her region. She has worked with this type of activity for two years already. She learned this type of business from her parents, who had a financially difficult life, just like their daughter. 

Currently Jamila does not have enough money to purchase a batch of almonds to sell. She hopes very much for financial support to continue her retail business. Please support her.

loans.use: to purchase and sell almonds

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge es un joven trabajador de 22 años de edad, vive en Ica junto a su cónyuge. Desde muy joven ha trabajado para poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, y ahora que tiene su pareja está proyectándose para formar una familia. Con mucho esfuerzo pudo comprarse un auto y actualmente trabaja como taxista brindando un servicio de calidad a los clientes. 
Jorge está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá cambiar el motor de su vehículo para no tener inconvenientes en el trabajo. De esta manera sus ingresos mejorarán y seguirá esforzándose para poder sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en: Jorge is a hardworking 22 year old man. He lives in Ica with his wife. Since very young he has worked in order to give his family a better life, and now he is planning to form a family. With great effort he was able to buy a car, and he currently works as a taxi driver providing quality service to his customers. Jorge is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because with their support he will be able to change the motor of his vehicle so he has no problems with his job. This way his earnings will improve and he will continue working hard to move his family ahead.

loans.use: to repair the motor of his vehicle.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a diligent and loving person. She is very long client of ASKI. She knows her obligations in terms of social life, financial, and most especially in her family. 

Aida is engaged in selling diffrent products to the community. 

To have additional income, she is requesting a loan amounting to Php 10,000 to buy soft drinks, spices, a sack of rice and candies for her store.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, spices, a sack of rice and candies for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase various fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizers, pesticides and to cover other personal expenses. She shows that she works to be able to meet her needs. Her dream is for her family to have and work their own land and business.

loans.name: Crisilda

texts.en:
Crisilda is a 45-year-old married woman and mother of four grown-up children from Leyte, Philippines. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 20 years now. This is the source of their income. 

Several months ago, a typhoon hit the country and ruined their fishing boat. As of now, Crisilda is requesting a loan to buy materials to make a new fishing boat. With this, her husband will be able to go back to the fishing business, thus augmenting their income. 

In the future, Crisilda hopes to make their fishing business a success.

loans.use: to buy materials to make a new fishing boat

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman. She has four children, with ages ranging from 6 years to 15 years. She describes herself to be patient. She operates a retail business where she sells meat. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are good. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of meat. 

Mary's business goal is to be prosperous within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have more profits. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of meat

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is a married woman with three school-going children. They live at their own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past one year she has operated a tailoring business, operating from the market where neighbours and passersby are potential customers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation.

With the Kshs 50,000, she wants to purchase cloth materials, needles, and repair her broken sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials, needles, and repair her broken sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of pillows.

loans.name: Rina Dwi Rahayu

texts.en:
Rina, 30 years old, is a housewife. She lives in Melaya, in the west part of Bali. To fulfill her family's daily needs, she has a small kiosk located in front of her house. Her husband works as a furniture maker. He’s usually makes tables, chairs, cupboards, and other home furniture.

Rina needs a loan as capital to increase the amount of merchandise to sell in her kiosk. She will use her loan to purchase daily needs such as rice, soap, vegetables, oil, school needs, and kitchen needs. 

She wants to get more customers to come to her kiosk. She dreams of having enough savings to support her children's education, and from now on she will save all the profit. 

Rina spends 50.000 IDR for kitchen and school fees.

loans.use: to purchase daily needs, school needs and kitchen needs

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a married woman. She has four children, with ages ranging from 9 years to 16 years. She describes herself to be patient. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, washing soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for six years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

Pamela will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, and other items. 

Her business goal is to grow the business within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, and other items

loans.name: Efefania

texts.en:
Efefania is 44 years old and married with five children.  With three children in school, Efefania works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Efefania has been in this business for 15 years, and earns additional income from a bakery.

In the future, Efefania would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.
