loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Daisy works hard to support her family.

She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from vegetable vending.  Daisy is borrowing PHP16,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Daisy has been sustaining her business activities through the past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Franciscah

texts.en:
Franciscah is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house, which has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan Franciscah is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family and school fees.

Fatuma operates a grocery vegetables selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a wholesale business in the future. 

With the 40,000 Kenya shillings (KES) she wants to pay school fees. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine appreciates the previous loan that helped her expand her business.

Josephine has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other charcoal operators in her area.
 
With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
This is Myrna, a 57-year-old woman who is married with three kids. She manages a farm business with the help of her husband. Myrna is a very responsible person. According to her, she wanted to undergo training about crops so that she can maintain the quality of her farm business. Myrna is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase 2 sacks of seed and fertilizer.

Myrna hopes that she can provide a good life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Victor Antonio

texts.es:
Victor es un hombre muy trabajador, tiene 60 años de edad, es casado y vive en Sayan junto a su familia.
Desde muy joven ha trabajado para poder sacar adelante a su esposa y sus 6 hijos. Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación pudo brindar una educación de calidad a sus hijos y sobre todo inculcarles muchos valores que hoy los distinguen de las demás personas. Desde hace más de 15 años trabaja como Obrero en una prestigiosa empresa y le va muy bien porque tiene mucha experiencia y ha sabido ganarse el respeto de todos sus compañeros.
Victor está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá reparar su vivienda, como construir una pared a la entrada para mayor seguridad, gracias a esto su familia vivirá de manera más cómoda y segura, y él seguirá esforzándose para poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: 60-year-old Victor is a very hardworking man.  He is married and lives with his family in Sayan. He has worked since he was very young to support his wife and 6 children. Through tremendous effort and dedication he was able to pay for a good education for his children and, in particular, instil in them good values which help them stand out from other people. He has worked as a labourer in a prestigious firm for more than 15 years and all is going well for him because he has a good deal of experience and has been able to win the respect of all his colleagues. Victor is grateful to Kiva lenders because, with the help they have given him, he will be able to repair his home by building a wall at the entrance to make it more secure. This will allow his family to live more comfortably and securely and he will continue to strive to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to build a wall for his house

loans.name: Luz Myriam

texts.es:
Un saludo desde Colombia!

Laboriosa y soñadora, son dos palabras que describen perfectamente a Luz, una mujer trabajadora y de familia, que hace lo que este a su alcance para ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y esposo.

Se dedica al cultivo de flores en el municipio de Sonsón.

Esta es una actividad muy común en esta región y gran parte de sus habitantes la practican ya que sus raíces provienen de familias cultivadoras y humildes.

Ella posee gran conocimiento en esta materia y considera que necesita un pequeño impulso para incrementar sus ventas y aumentar su negocio, es por esta razón que solicita un auxilio económico para invertirlo en la compra de abonos, semillas, riegos y elementos para preparación de la tierra.

Con este préstamo podrá continuar con su actividad que es la única fuente de ingresos de su familia.

Se siente agradecida con la vida y con las entidades que apoyan este tipo de proyectos por todos los favores recibidos.
texts.en:
Greetings from Colombia!

Hardworking and idealistic - these are two words which describe Luz perfectly.  She is a hardworking, family-oriented woman who does everything she can to provide a better quality of life for her children and husband. She grows flowers in the town of Sonsón. This is a very common business in the area and many of the area's inhabitants do this as they come from modest families of growers. She is very knowledgeable about he business and believes that she needs a little boost to increase her sales and expand her business.  This is why she is applying for financial help to invest in the purchase of manure, seeds, irrigation systems and materials needed to prepare the land. The loan will enable her to keep her business going as it is her family's only source of income. She is happy with her life and is grateful to the organisations who support projects such as this for all the help they have given her.

loans.use: Compra de abonos, semillas, riegos y elementos para preparación de la tierra.

loans.name: Ceida Isabel

texts.es:
Al hablar de Ceida podemos evidenciar que es una mujer muy trabajadora y servicial que todo lo que hace es en bien de su familia y bienestar de la misma.

Ella vive en una humilde casa en el municipio de Turbo donde convive con su esposo y sus hijos por los cuales ha luchado para darles una vida digna y una educación de calidad.

Ella se gana la vida con la compra y venta de plátano y tiene plena fe en su negocio ya que con este ha tratado de sostener a su familia y sobrevivir en estos tiempos tan difíciles.

Es una mujer emprendedora, constante y muy amante de sus hijos.

Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar cajas de plátano al por mayor, adicional a esto requiere capitalizar su negocio para tener un amplio inventario disponible para vender a sus clientes.

Ella tiene la esperanza de poder encontrar ayuda en las personas de corazón solidario.

Apoya a una mujer campesina y emprendedora de Colombia con un préstamo!
texts.en:
On talking to Ceida we can see that she is a very hardworking and attentive woman, and that everything she does is to benefit her family and her own wellbeing.

She lives in a modest house in the municipality of Turbo which she shares with her husband and her children, for whom she has fought to give a respectable life and a quality education.

She earns her living buying and selling bananas and has every faith in her business as with it she has been able to sustain her family and survive in these very difficult times.

She is an entrepreneurial, persevering woman, and very fond of her children.

She is asking for a loan to buy cases of bananas wholesale. In addition to this she needs to capitalise her business to have a large inventory available to sell to her clients.

She has the hope of being able to find help from people with caring hearts.

Support an entrepreneurial country woman from Columbia with a loan!

loans.use: to buy cases of bananas wholesale to sell and to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies to cultivate corn and beans.

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine is a married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 12 to 18 years old, and she describes herself as ambitious. 

She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 4 years, and it is located in a safe location. She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in weather. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: To buy more stock of charcoal

loans.name: Enriquita

texts.en:
Enriquita is 50 years old with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a gasoline retail in the Philippines and requested a PHP22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional gallons of gasoline to sell.

Enriquita has been in this business for four years. 

In the future she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Edita

texts.en:
Edita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell. She has been in this business for 26 years, and also earns more income from selling fish.

Edita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 57 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Norma has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Norma aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Yireth Group

texts.es:
Jacqueline es la Tesorera de Banco Mujer Yireth, un grupo que solicita su segundo a crédito a Fundación Mujer, la responsabilidad y entrega caracteriza a este grupo formado por 5 socias que van a invertir en actividades comerciales. 
Doña Jacqueline tiene 29 años, 2 hijos pequeños, es madre sola ya que el padre de sus hijos se fue y los dejo cuando  nació su segundo hijo, actualmente vive con sus padres, su mamá le ayuda con el cuidado de sus hijos para ella poder salir a vender. Está mujer tan luchadora se dedica a la venta de productos por catalogo, vende en su comunidad y otras cercanas, todo tipo de productos como; cosméticos, perfumes, ropa, lencería y artículos para el hogar. Está nueva inversión de capital de trabajo será para la compra de mas mercadería para atender sus pedidos que han aumentado al igual q su clientela. Ella trabaja muy duro para mejorar las condiciones de vida, poder tener una casa para ella y sus 2 hijos.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is the treasurer of the Mujer Yireth bank, a group that is asking for its second loan from Fundación Mujer.  Responsibility and dedication characterize this group formed of 5 members who will invest in their businesses.

Jacqueline is 29 years old, has 2 small children, and is a single mother since the father of her children went away and left them when the second child was born. She currently lives with her parents and her mother helps her with the care of the children so that she can leave to sell.  This very determined woman works selling products from a catalog; she sells in her community and others nearby.  She sells all sorts of products such as cosmetics, perfumes, clothing, lingerie, and household products.  This new investment of working capital will be to purchase more merchandise to take care of the orders that have increased along with her customer base. She works very hard to improve the living conditions, and to be able to have a house for herself and her two children.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, cosmetics, lingerie, and household items to sell.

loans.name: Maria Julia

texts.es: Doña Maria Julia, se dedica a producir tortillas (que es el acompañante de comidas diarias en la dieta salvadoreña). Tiene mas de 8 años de dedicarse a la venta de tortillas en la colonia en la que vive. sus vecinos la prefieren porque mantiene las tortillas calientitas para la hora del almuerzo y la cena. En la fotografia se puede observar el proceso final, que es la formación de la tortilla con la mano (mezcla de maiz cocido y molido, con un poco de agua y sal), que coloca en una plancha de hierro muy caliente, en la que dejará la tortilla unos 2 minutos para que pueda cocinarse y este lista para consumirse. Ella solicita apoyo para la compra de los insumos de producccion de sus tortillas
texts.en: Maria Julia works making tortillas (which is the accompaniment to the daily meals in the Salvadoran diet). She has worked more than 8 years selling tortillas in the area where she lives.  Her neighbors prefers her because she keeps the tortillas warm for lunch and dinner time.  In the photograph, one can see the final process, which is forming the tortilla (a mix of cooked and milled corn, with a little water and salt) by hand, that she puts on a very hot iron griddle, where she will leave the tortilla for 2 minutes so it can cook and be ready for consumption. She asks for support to purchase the supplies to make tortillas.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make tortillas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fix up her son's bedroom.

loans.name: Jonathan Denis

texts.es:
Jonathan es un joven emprendedor, soltero, tiene 20 años de edad y vive en Parcona junto a su familia. Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante, actualmente estudia la carrera profesional de Ingeniería de Sistemas e Informática y también trabaja como Jefe de Mozo en un restaurante. Con su propio esfuerzo ha ganado un ascenso en su centro laboral porque siempre se esfuerza en todo lo que hace porque quiere sacar adelante a su familia.
Jonathan está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar una laptop para poder realizar sus trabajos de la Universidad y de esta manera tener mejores calificaciones y más adelante poder convertirse en un excelente empresario.
texts.en: Jonathan is an enterprising young man, single and 20 years old, who lives in Parcona with his family. He is a person with great desire to get ahead, and currently is studying for a professional degree in systems engineering and information technology, and also works as the head waiter at a restaurant.  With his own efforts, he has earned a promotion in his workplace because he always works hard in everything he does since he wants to get his family ahead.  Jonathan is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because, with the help they have offered him, he will be able to purchase a laptop to be able to do his university assignments and in this way get better grades and in the future be able to become an excellent businessman.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Yireth Group

texts.es:
Heilyn con apenas 20 años de edad, tiene un hijo de 4 años, es madre soltera y vive con sus padres, para solventar los gastos que demanda su hijo, ella inicio en el comercio de forma ambulante, vende perfumes, maquillaje y todo tipo de cosméticos, se considera una buena vendedora, con excelente atención a sus clientes. Con los ingresos que genera su actividad se hace cargo de los gastos de su niño, ayuda a su madre y paga sus estudios, esto es muy importante para ella, concluir sus estudios de secundaria ya que tiene muchas aspiraciones para el futuro. Heylin solicita su segundo crédito, y es para la compra de lociones y cremas ya que tiene muchos pedidos. El crédito es una herramienta muy importante porque le permite tener más mercadería a disposición de sus clientes, y así aumentar sus ventas. Heilyn está convencida que trabajando con esmero lograra lo que se proponga, y podrá darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo. 
Junto a Heiyn conforman el grupo 3 socias más que van a invertir en actividades comerciales.
texts.en:
Heilyn, barely 20 years old, has a 4-year-old son, is a single mother, and lives with her parents.  To pay for the costs her son requires, she began selling as a street vendor.  She sells perfumes, makeup and all sorts of cosmetics; she considers herself a good saleswoman with excellent customer service.  With the income that her work generates, she takes care of her son's expenses, helps her mother, and pays for her education. It is very important for her to finish her secondary education, since she has many aspirations for the future. Heylin asks for a second loan, and it is to purchase lotions and creams since she has many orders already. The loan is a very important tool because it permits her to have more merchandise ready for her customers and, in turn, increase her sales. Heilyn is convinced that working with care she will achieve what she sets out to do, and will be able to give a better quality of life to her son. 

Along with Heilyn are 3 other members of the group who will invest in businesses.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, lotions and creams for sale.

loans.name: Imboneza Group

texts.fr:
Jérôme fait partie du groupe  Imboneza  et  habite à  Gitega. Il a 60 ans et est marié à Thérèse, un cultivateur. Ensemble ils ont  8 enfants ages de 9 à 25 ans dont  7 étudient.

Il fait le commerce de banane  depuis  6 ans. 

Il est à son deuxième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de bananes, à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en: Jérôme is a member of the Imboneza Group and lives in Gitega. He is 60 years old and is married to Therese, a farmer. Together, they have eight children, ages 9 to 25, seven of which attend school.  He has been selling bananas for six years.  He is on his second loan with Turame. With this Kiva loan, he will increase his capital and buy a large quantity of bananas for resale to earn more.

loans.use: to buy bananas.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: Don Edwin, tiene un gimnasio desde hace 10 años, que esta ubicado en las cercanías de centros escolares. su objetivo es brindar un espacio para que los jóvenes puedan ejercitarse y tener una opción de distracción sana y alejarse de la delicada situación delincuencial que afecta principalmente a este segmento de población. En la fotografía, se le puede observar junto a parte de su equipo, el cual desea incrementar para seguir apoyando a los jovenes. Con ese objetivo, el solicita apoyo financiero para adquirir un nuevo equipo
texts.en: Edwin has had a gym for 10 years, that is located near some schools. His objective is to offer his space so that youth can exercise and have an option for healthy entertainment and remove themselves from the sensitive criminal situation that primarily affects this segment of the population. In the photograph, one can see him with some of his equipment, which he wants to increase to continue supporting the youth. With this goal, he asks for financial support to purchase new equipment.

loans.use: to purchase machinery for his gym.

loans.name: Emelinda

texts.es: Doña Emelinda, se dedica a la venta de ropa para personas jóvenes (pantalones, shorts, camisas y camisetas) desde hace 3 años, realiza su venta en un puesto ubicado en una zona comercial activa. Su grupo familiar lo constituye un hijo, que aun estudia. En la fotografía se puede observar a Doña Emelinda, mostrando parte de la mercadería que ofrece a sus clientes. Ella solicita apoyo para la adquisicion de mercaderia para la temporada de venta para la celebración del dia del alumno, festividad que se realiza en cada centro escolar, para lo cual los jovenes suelen usar ropa nueva.
texts.en: Emelinda has worked selling clothing for young people (pants, shorts, shirts, and t-shirts) for the past 3 years. She completes her sales in a location in a busy commercial zone. Her family consists of her son who is still a student. In the photograph, one can see Emelinda showing part of the merchandise she offers her customers. She asks for a loan to purchase seasonal merchandise to sell for the Day of the Student, a festival that is celebrated in every school, for which the students tend to wear new clothing.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise.

loans.name: Nongtaaba De Yaoghin Group

texts.fr:
Mme HAWA représente le groupe NONGTAABA DE YAOGHIN. Mariée, elle est mère de 07enfants. Le plus âgé a 24ans et le moins âgé a 08ans. 03 vont à l’école et elle a 04personnes en charge.
Mme fait le jardinage (oignon) depuis plus de 23ans. Elle s’approvisionne avec ses voisins.
Elle veut s’acheter 02 planches d’oignon,  06 kg d’engrais et 01 boite d’insecticide.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut entretenir ses enfants, s’occuper des charges multiples de la famille. Elle ambitionne agrandir son activité et s’acheter un moyen de déplacement.
texts.en: Ms. Hawa represents the Nongtaaba de Yaoghin Group. She is married and mother of seven children; the oldest is 24 and the youngest is 8.  Three attend school and she has four dependents.  Ms. Hawa has grown onions for over 23 years.  She buys supplies with her neighbors.  She wants to buy two rows of onions, six kg of fertilizer, and one box of insecticide.  With her profits, she wants to support her children and take care of the family expenses.  Her goal is to grow her business and to buy a means of transportation.

loans.use: to buy 2 rows of onions, 6 kg of fertilizer and 1 box of insecticide.

loans.name: Lilliam Maria

texts.es: Lilliam Maria, mayor de edad madre soltera de un hijo aun bajo su responsabilidad, originaria de Chichigalpa, municipio del departamento de  Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país zona que se caracteriza por ser productivamente comercial, turística y donde existe uno de los ingenios mas grande del país, Lilliam es una microempresaria y administradora de dos negocios los cuales están ubicados en su casa de habitación que consisten en la venta de mercadería en general donde ofrece productos al detalle de forma ambulante y en su domicilio productos como: variedades estilos de ropa para adultos, niños, productos plásticos, sabanas, zapatos, cosméticos,  entre otros ya sean por encargos y para tener en su pulperia donde ofrece productos de consumo diarios como:granos básicos, golosinas, aceite, productos congelados, detergentes, huevos, sopas maggis, jabón, toallas sanitarias, papel higiénicos, bolsas de leche, bolsitas de avenas, shampoo entre otros mas, estos productos los compra al contado a camiones distribuidores, distribuidoras y  en los mercados aledaños a su domicilio,sus ventas son al contado y al crédito a clientes fijos y eventuales, en el caso de las mercadería sus compras son al contado en mercados de mayoreos de otro departamento del país, estos negocios ya tienen mas de cinco años de dedicarse a estos el cual surgen como un medio de fuente de trabajo el cual le ha ayudado a mejorar los ingresos de su hogar, uno de sus sueños es poder crecer mas en su negocio y  sacar adelante a su hija para que ella puede seguir estudiando y se ha toda una profesional,el objetivo de este nuevo financiamiento es para invertir en capital de trabajo el cual usara para invertir en sus negocios en la compra de productos de consumo del hogar como: granos básicos, golosinas, productos congelados al igual que mercedaria en general como: variedades de ropa, cosméticos, chineria entre otros, para obtener mejores ingresos y tener una estabilidad económica, Lilliam agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas Kivas brindan a personas con escasos recurso para tener un medio digno de trabajo.
texts.en:
Lilliam Maria, an older single mother with a son still in her care, is originally from Chichigalpa, a municipality in Chinandega department, located in the west of the country, which is a zone characterized as commercially productive, touristic, and where one of the largest sugar factories of the country is located.

Lilliam is a small business owner and manager of two business which are located in her house and consist of the sale of general merchandise where she offers products as a street vendor and also in her home such as a variety of clothing styles for adults and children, plastic products, sheets, shoes, and cosmetics among other items whether they be by order or to have in her store.  There, she offers products for everyday consumption such as basic grains, candies, oils, frozen products, detergent, eggs, Maggis soups, soap, paper towels, toilet paper, bags of milk, little bags of oats, and shampoo among other products. She buys these products with cash from distribution trucks, in distribution centers, and in markets near her home. Her sales are made with cash and credit to regular and occasional customers. In the case of the merchandise, her purchases are made with cash in the wholesale markets of another department in the country. She has been working in these businesses for more than five years, which began as a way to have a source of work which has helped her increase her household income. One of her dreams is to be able to grow her business more and get her daughter ahead so that she can continue studying and become a professional. The goal of this new loan is to invest in working capital which she will use to invest in her businesses by buying products for household consumption such as basic grains, candies, and frozen goods as well as general merchandise such as a variety of clothing, cosmetics, and low cost consumer goods, among others, so as to have better income and economic stability. Lilliam is thankful for the help Kiva investors offer to people of limited resources to have a means of dignified work.

loans.use: to purchase products for everyday consumption such as basic grains, candies, a variety of clothing, and shoes among others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: with his pineapple plantation.

loans.name: Fatou Saliou's Group

texts.fr:
Créé le 21 Mai 2003 à l’inauguration du banc villageois, ce groupe est composé de femmes qui ont pour la majorité plus de 08 années d’expérience vu que le banc villageois  vient  d’entamer ses vingt deuxième cycles dans le programme. Elles sont toutes issues du même village et partageant des liens forts de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce, accompagné de l’agriculture sous pluie.

Madame Fatou Saliou (assise à l’extrême droite est avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle âgée de 32 ans, c’est une jeune dame très engagée dans son commerce. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants une fille et un garçon. Elle s’active dans la vente de produits de la mer plus particulièrement le poisson fumé et séché. Elle achète sa marchandise auprès de revendeurs en provenance des zones côtières du sud et nord ouest du pas, pour la revente au détail et par pièce dans son village et les alentours.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 02 paniers de poisson fumé à 15 000 Fr CFA l’un, un panier de poisson séché à 12 500 Fr CFA.

Avec des bénéfices moyens de 13 000 Fr CFA, elle aide son mari dans la gestion des charges quotidiennes du foyer en plus de la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en: Created on May 21, 2003 at the inauguration of the "banc villageois", this group consists of women who have for the most part eight years of experience since the banc villageois just started its 20th cycle in the program.  They all come from the same village and share strong ties and help each other.  Their main activity is small business, along with farming during the rainy season. Ms. Fatou Saliou (sitting at the far right with her hand raised) is the representative borrower of this group. She is 32 years old and a young woman very engaged in her business. She is married and mother of two children, one girl and one boy.  She sells seafood, especially smoked fish and dried fish. She buys her merchandise, from resellers in coastal areas to the south and northwest, for resale in her village and surroundings.  With her new loan, she plans to buy two baskets of smoked fish for 15,000 FCFA and one basket of dried fish for 12,500 FCFA. With an average profit of 13,000 FCFA, she helps her husband take care of their daily household expenses as well as the school fees of their children.

loans.use: to buy two baskets of smoked fish and one basket of dried fish.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita, 33, is a married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Nenita has a bread retailing business in the Philippines. Nenita has been in this business for three years.

Nenita requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks of bread to sell to customers.

In the future, Nenita would like to save enough money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of bread to sell to customers.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 44 years old, married, and has five children, two of whom are currently in school.

Elena is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She has been in pig fattening for seven years now and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Elena requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feeds and vitamins for her business.

In the future, Elena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feeds and vitamins for her business.

loans.name: Didar

texts.en:
Didar is a married mother of two children who runs her own hair and makeup salon in order to earn a living, while her husband works as an auto mechanic.

She has been operating her business for more than 12 years now and has a lot of customers that make her successful and provide a good income for her. 

Right now, she is requesting a loan in order to purchase the materials she needs for her work, such as various makeup and styling tools. In the future, she hopes to expand her business even more and be able to hire an employee. She is very grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: To purchase the materials she needs for her work such as various makeup and styling tools.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 51 years old and married. She has five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Evelyn requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell like soap, shampoo, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

Evelyn has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell like soap, shampoo, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Bayati

texts.en:
Bayati is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro in the Iganga region of Uganda. 

For the past two years, Bagati has been working hard to manage her small vegetable business, which sells vegetables. 

To help expand her business, Bayati has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more tomatoes, onions and carrots for sale, and it will help Bayati to generate greater profits and open up a charcoal business. 

Bayati hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house. 

Bayati is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes, onions and carrots for sale.

loans.name: Enma Estela

texts.es:
En la calle San Eduardo vía a Santa Ana de la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito 16 de Julio.
En este lugar vive la señora Enma, tiene 55 años de edad, hace muchos años su querido esposo falleció pero de esta relación tuvieron tres hijos los mismos que  ya son mayores de edad pero aun viven con ella. Ella hace varios años aprendió corte y confección en una academia de la localidad.
Doña Enma con la finalidad de obtener sus propios ingresos y aprovechando sus conocimientos en corte y confección puso en su casa un pequeño taller de costura, allí se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa y manualidades hechas en fomix con diferentes modelos y motivos, lo cual también es otra actividad que aprendió y que hoy le permiten ganarse la vida, todos sus trabajos los realiza a base de pedidos de personas particulares, ella en temporadas también elabora uniformes para instituciones, escuelas y colegios de la localidad. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas, fomix y otros materiales para la costura y manualidades. Lleva 8 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe del grupo. Sus sueños son tener un taller más grande.
texts.en:
On San Eduardo street, on the way to Santa Ana, in Portoviejo city, known as the Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos from colonial times, the members of the 16 de Julio communal bank meet every two weeks.

In this place, Enma lives. She is 55 years old, and many years ago her beloved husband died, but from this relationship they had three children who are now adults but still live with her. Some years ago, she learned tailoring in a school in her area.  

With the goal of having her own income and taking advantage of her tailoring knowledge, Enma established a small sewing workshop in her house. There, she works making all sorts of clothing and crafts made from craft foam with different models and purposes, which is another activity she learned and today allows her to earn her living.  All of her work is done based on individual orders.  In some seasons, she also makes uniforms for schools of different levels in her area.  She works every day from 6:00 am to 10:00 pm and sometimes later when she has orders to complete.

This new loan will be used to purchase fabric, craft foam, and other materials for sewing and crafts. She has been in the communal bank for 8 years and she likes it for the help she gets from the group.  Her dream is to have a larger workshop.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, craft foam and other supplies for sewing and making crafts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to grow his business and to buy another washing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of bread, milk, salt and other items.

loans.name: Danijela

texts.en:
Danijela, 29, is a mother of two children, 6 and 9 years old. 

She and her husband are working in a clinic; she as a nurse and he as a technical assistant. They live in a minority community, in a house that is very old with a roof that needs repair urgently. 

For the first time, she is requesting a loan to repair the roof in order to improve their living conditions and provide a healthy and dry environment. She hopes to offer her children a better education in the future and promises to pay on time.

loans.use: To repair the roof in order to improve their living conditions.

loans.name: Angela Rosa

texts.es:
En la calle San Eduardo vía a Santa Ana de la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito 16 de Julio.
En este lugar vive la señora Ángela, tiene 53 años está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos ya mayores de edad, dos de ellos  aun viven con ella. Su esposo es maestro de colegio.
Doña Angela es una mujer muy buena y trabajadora que para aportar con los gastos que genera el hogar se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, zapatos, productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), joyas de  Romanel y pastillas para dieta lo cual tiene mucha salida que hace poco empezó a vender, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y en su casa si alguno de sus clientes necesita de algo de lo que ella vende, trabaja todos los días unas tres horas diarias, entrega sus productos a crédito  y cobra cada semana, lleva más de 15 años con esta actividad la cual le ha dado muy buenos beneficios.
Este crédito es para  comprar ropa, cosméticos y joyas para poder cumplir con los pedidos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el segundo ciclo y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le han dado los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio y su vida familiar.
texts.en:
On San Eduardo street, on the way to Santa Ana, in Portoviejo city, known as the Citudad de los Reales Tamarindos from colonial times, the members of the 16 de Julio communal bank meet every two weeks. 

In this place lives Ángela, who is 53 years old, married, and in this relationship has three children who are now adults, two of them still live with them.  Her husband is a teacher.

Ángela is a very good and hard-working woman who, in order to help with the household expenses, works in business, selling all sorts of clothing, shoes, Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and ladies' accessories), Romanel jewelry and diet pills which have a lot of opportunities since she recently began to sell them. She sells door-to-door and in her house if some of her customers need something that she is selling.  She works three hours every day, she provides her products on credit and collects every week. She has been doing this work for over 15 years, and it has given her many benefits.

This loan is to purchase clothing, cosmetics, and jewelry to be able to meet her orders. She has been part of the communal bank since the second loan cycle and she likes it for the help that the loans have always given her. Her dream is to continue on with her business and her family life.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, cosmetics and jewelry.

loans.name: Noris Fatima

texts.es:
En la calle San Eduardo vía a Santa Ana de la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito 16 de Julio.
En este lugar vive la señora Noris, tiene 52 años, es casada  y tiene tres hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven con ella, el marido es chofer.
Doña Noris es una ama de casa que para obtener ingresos propios y con esto ayudarle a su marido con los con los gastos del hogar se dedica  a la venta de productos  Yanbal (perfumes, cremas, bisutería, etc.), sabanas, edredones entre otras cosas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta aunque también vende en su casa donde sus clientes llegan cuando necesitan algún producto, deja a crédito y cobra cada semana, lleva más de 12 años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual se gana algo por el bien de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, bisuterías y sabanas. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten financiar su negocio. Sus sueños es darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
On San Eduardo street, on the way to Santa Ana, in Portoviejo city, known as the Citudad de los Reales Tamarindos from colonial times, the members of the 16 de Julio communal bank meet every two weeks. 

In this place lives Noris, who is 52 years old, married and has three adult children, two of them who still live with her. Her husband is a driver.

Noris is a housewife who, in order to have her own income and, with this, help her husband with the household expenses, works selling Yanbal products (perfumes, creams, costume jewelry, etc.), bed linen, and quilts among other things. She sells door-to-door but also sells in her house where her customers come when they need a product. She sells on credit and collects each week. She has been doing this work for over 12 years, with which she earns something for the good of her family. This loan is to purchase perfumes, creams, costume jewelry and bed linen. She has been in the communal bank from the beginning and she likes it because the loans have allowed her to finance her business. Her dream is to give the best to her family.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, creams, costume jewelry and bed linen.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma appreciates the previous loan she received as it helped her expand her business. She operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces stiff competition from other charcoal sellers in her area.
 
With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) she is requesting, she wants to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell. Fatuma decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy 20 sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Nyakerario

texts.en:
Nyakerario, 51 years of age, is a small-scale farmer who hails from the Nyamira area of Kenya, an area with good weather and rainfall patterns. The Nyamira area is an area popularly known because it’s a banana growing region and the staple food is “matoke,” a mouthwatering delicacy prepared from bananas. She is a mother and has been blessed with five school-going children whom she really adores and cherishes. 

For the past 20 years, she has been involved in farming, and through those years she has gathered so much experience and all the farming techniques are at her fingertips. Because of the immense knowledge she has of farming, she offers free advice to upcoming farmers and also free extension services to her neighbors. Her primary sources of income have been tea, crops and dairy farming.

Nyakerario is seeking a loan to start poultry farming, and she has a strong conviction that through the loan, her life will permanently change. Poultry farming is one of the profitable business ventures in Kenya and there is a ready market because the demand for chicken meat is high. Through the loan, Nyakerario is going to benefit from egg selling, meat selling and also selling of poultry feathers. 

For women like Nyakerario, having access to financial resources through Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva will increase their productivity and improve their future.

She has gone through financial training and she is very disciplined with finances. Profits from the business will be used in fully paying back the loan and assuring her school-going children of uninterrupted learning and better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: Fetije

texts.en:
Fetije is a a mother of five children. She is a housewife while her husband is a guard and her sons are employed by a construction company. They all live together in a very small house, which is old and in need of some repairs and renovations. 

Through the years they have not been able to save enough money to do the renovations, so she is requesting a loan in order to complete these repairs. Without this loan she will never be able to do this and improve the living conditions of her family. 

Her goal is to be able to give her children a better future and she wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: To renovate her house to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a married woman and a mother of five children from Leyte, Philippines. 

Emma runs a small sari-sari or variety store in her place. This is the source of her income. 

Emma's business was greatly affected when typhoon Haiyan hit the country. As of this moment, Emma has just started again with her business. She is requesting a loan to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, biscuits, bread and chips, soap and toiletries, vegetables and seasonings. With this, she will be able to augment her stocks and attract more buyers in her store. 

In the future, Emma hopes of expanding her business so that it will generate more income necessary for the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of their children.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her grocery store.

loans.name: Brígida Eufemia

texts.es:
En la calle San Eduardo vía a Santa Ana, de la ciudad de Portoviejo conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito 16 de Julio.
En este lugar vive la señora Brígida, tiene 63 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cinco hijos mayores de edad, una de sus hijos vive con ella, su esposo es jubilado. 
Doña Brígida es una muy  buena esposa que para lograr sus propios recursos y con estos ayudarle a su marido con los gastos que genera el hogar se dedica a la cocina, ella tiene un pequeño puesto de comida cerca de su casa, allí prepara además de platos fuertes comida rápida como empanadas, corviches, humitas y otros, trabaja de jueves a domingo desde las 16h00 hasta las 20h00  y su esposo le ayuda en su trabajo, lleva más de 7 años con esta actividad con la cual salen adelante.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar víveres para preparar los platos. Ella es socia fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre ha recibido para el bienestar de su familia. Sus sueños son tener un gran local.
texts.en:
On San Eduardo street, on the way to Santa Ana, in Portoviejo city, known as the Citudad de los Reales Tamarindos from colonial times, the members of the 16 de Julio communal bank meet every two weeks.

In this place lives Brígida, who is 63 years old, married, and from this relationship has five adult children; one of her children lives with her, and her husband is retired. 

Brígida is a very good wife who, in order to have her own resources, and, with them, help her husband with the household expenses, works cooking. She has a small food stall near her house, and there she prepares entrees and also fast food such as empanadas, corviches, humitas (tamales) and others.  She works Thursday to Sunday from 4:00pm to 8:00pm and her husband helps her with her work. She has been in this work for over 7 years, with which they get ahead. 

This loan will be used to purchase groceries to prepare her dishes. She is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it for the help that she has always gotten for the well-being of her family. Her dream is to have a large retail space.

loans.use: to purchase groceries.

loans.name: Nemanja

texts.en:
Nemanja is 26 years old and recently married, living in a minority community. He is employed in a municipality doing administrative work, while his wife works in their own food shop that they have had for three years now.

At their shop they sell various foods and beverages. They are trying to save money to be able to start a family and have children soon. This is the first loan that they are requesting to more stock for the shop. He is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy more stock for their shop

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 53 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Elisa is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Elisa has been in pig fattening for 20 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renovate the façade of the house and repair their roof

loans.name: Osman

texts.en:
Osman lives in a small minority community in Kosovo. He is married and the father of one son. Based on tradition, he has been involved in agriculture in order to earn a living. He plants corn, wheat and different vegetables to sell in the neighborhood and at the market. 

Overall, Osman is very satisfied with his life in the village and his business. Working for so long on his land, his tools are very old and damaged and Osman would like to have a loan in order to purchase new tools for his agricultural machine. This loan will help him to complete his work in a more effective and efficient manner, increasing his income and improving his living conditions. He is grateful for this opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new attachments for his agricultural machine

loans.name: Mnyaka

texts.en:
Mnyaka is a married woman living together with her husband and eight children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past seventeen years, she has operated a petrol-selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business to become a wholesale supplier of petrol in the market. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase gallons of petrol for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase gallons of petrol for resale

loans.name: Victorine

texts.en:
Victorine is a single woman. She describes herself as disciplined. She operates a retail business where she sells cosmetics. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are good. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. 

Victorine will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of cosmetics. Her business goal is to be prosperous within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will increase her income. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cosmetics

loans.name: Amit

texts.en: Amit is 46 years old and performs as a musician for weddings and other celebrations and events to make a living. He works together with his son and they are able to enjoy a lot of success and profit during the summer and spring seasons when there is a lot of work for them. During these months, they save all of the money they make in order to live in the slow seasons of fall and winter. Their house is very old and in need of repairs so Amit is requesting a loan in order to repair the roof and flooring. He hopes that the loan will improve the family's living conditions and he wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to repair his roof and flooring

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna is 46 years old, married and has three children. She is a vendor and a day care worker, while her husband is a farmer. She runs a grocery store that earns about 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month. She uses it for her children's education expenses and for daily meals. She is now taking out a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy more stock for her store such as canned goods, eggs, biscuits, noodles, coffee and soap. She hopes to achieve good profits so that she can continue to give her children a good education.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her store

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be disciplined. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

Rosemary will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to be prosperous within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Muriel

texts.en:
Muriel is 40 years old and married with two children.  With two children in school, Muriel works very hard to provide for them.

Muriel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Muriel has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Muriel would like to save enough money to expand his business and continue to send his children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of four children, Mercy works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit and vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Mercy is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional fruits and vegetables to sell for her fruit and vegetable vending business.

Mercy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is married and has four children, all of whom attend school and are working.  They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for the family.

For the past seven years, she has operated a dried fish selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also does farming which earns her another source of livelihood. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of becoming a major supplier of dried fish in the near future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase 2 sacks of dried fish for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of dried fish for resale.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 64 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Merlita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as bread, sugar, soft drinks and other groceries. 

In the future, Merlita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
Myra is 33 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

Myra has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Merigrace

texts.en: Merigrace is 45 years old and has a child. She is a vendor selling food while her spouse manages a farming business. Merigrace wanted to improve her sales and she needs to add additional items to sell for added income. She is now asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy beans, biscuits and other grocery items to sell. She hopes to keep making her sales profitable and improve her profits as well.

loans.use: to buy beans, biscuits and other grocery items to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past fifteen years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Florence dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future. 

With the loan of Kes 40,000 that she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, and beans.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a married woman. She describes herself to be self-disciplined. She operates a retail business where she sells fish and tomatoes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

Irene will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fish and tomatoes. Her business goal is to be prosperous within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved income. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish and tomatoes

loans.name: Ángel Francisco

texts.es:
En la calle San Eduardo vía a Santa Ana de la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito 16 de Julio.
En este lugar vive don Ángel, tiene 64 años de edad, es divorciado y de esta relación tiene dos hijos mayores que estudian en otras ciudades y aun dependen de él.
El señor Ángel es un hombre muy emprendedor que le gusta trabajar para salir adelante y para darles la mejor educación a sus hijos, el tiene un local que arrienda en las cercanía de su casa en el cual tiene un mini Marquet, allí vende toda clase de  víveres así como también carne, pescado, legumbres y muchos otros productos, el también en este mismo lugar tiene una panadería la cual es muy concurrida ya que sus clientes encuentran de todo en su local, trabaja con una persona a quien le paga un sueldo mensual por su labor. Gracias a este negocio el sale adelante.
Este crédito es para  comprar víveres para surtir su mini Marquet y harina e ingredientes para preparar el pan. Lleva 3 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten financiar en parte su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
On San Eduardo street on the way to Santa Ana, in the city of Portoviejo, known as the City of the Royal Tamarinds since the colonial era, the 16 de Julio credit group meets every two weeks. 

This is where Ángel lives. He is 64 years old, divorced and has two grown children who go to school in other cities and still depend on him. Ángel is a very enterprising man who likes to work to get ahead and give the best education to his children. He has a locale that he rents close to his house where he runs a mini-market. He sells all types of groceries including meat, fish, vegetables and many other products. He also has a bread bakery which is very popular because his customers find everything at his locale. He works with a person that he pays a monthly salary. Thanks to this business he gets ahead. This loan is to buy groceries to stock his mini market and flour and ingredients to make the bread. He has been in the credit group for 3 years and he likes it because the loans allow him to partially finance his business. His dream is to keep improving his business.

loans.use: to buy groceries, flour and ingredients to make bread.

loans.name: Basti

texts.en:
Basti is 55 years old, married with two sons. The elder of them is married, the younger is studying in his second course of medical college. Basti is living in Bala-Bahmanli village of Füzuli region with her lovely family; the family members are IDPs, internally displaced persons,  from their native land Füzuli city for over 21 years. She has been in the sheep-breeding business for many years; she learned this business from her mother-in-law. 

Basti sells milk and cheese which she prepares herself;  she also sells mutton. The stall for her sheep collapsed and today, Basti needs 2300 AZN to build a new stall. She says thanks to Kiva for the help.

loans.use: to pay for building a new stall

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Myrna has been in this business for 30 years. Myrna earns more income from food vending.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a married woman and a mother of seven children from Leyte, Philippines. Flora is engaged in a fish vending business. Her husband is a fisherman. Flora is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, a weighing scale and gasoline for the fishing boat. With this, they will be able to improve their catch, thus allowing them to sell more fish in the market. 

In the future, Flora has hopes of making their fishing business a success so that it will generate more income. Moreover, she wants to continue in supporting her children's education.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, a weighing scale and gasoline for the fishing boat

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en:
Philomena is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be obedient. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

Philomena will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to be prosperous within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have increased sales. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en:
Warlita works hard to support her family. Warlita is married and has an ice candy business in the Philippines.

Warlita requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more ingredients for her ice candy. She has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Warlita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for her ice candy.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 40 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by doing pig fattening in the Philippines. Nora is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Nora has been in pig fattening for two years and also earns additional income from fruit vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha  is a married woman and has been blessed with four children. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a milk-selling business, selling milk to her neighbours and passersby. She cites theft and competition as her major challenges in her business. 

Martha is requesting Kshs 30,000 to boost her kiosk and purchase gallons of milk for resale. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase gallons of milk for resale

loans.name: Rosally

texts.en:
Rosally is 38 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Rosally has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a female Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be God-fearing, kind, and motivated. She operates a retail business where she sells books and other stationery. She describes her challenge to be lack of enough water supply. 

She will use the Kes 75,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This will benefit six family members. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to access clean water. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use

loans.name: Kasifa's Group

texts.en:
Kasifa's group is comprised of four hard working women. Kasifa is 17 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past three years, Kasifa has been working hard to manage her clothing business, which sells new clothes. 

To help expand her business, Kasifa has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more new clothes to sell and will help Kasifa to generate greater profits and pay for her sisters' school fees. Kasifa hopes that in the future she will be able to become self reliant because she shares her business with her mother. 

Kasifa is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more new clothes for sale,

loans.name: Priscela Yesenia

texts.es:
En la calle San Eduardo vía a Santa Ana de la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito 16 de Julio.
En este lugar  vive la señora Priscela, tiene 36 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos  hijos de 10 y 6 años que estudian en escuela. Lleva 2 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
Doña Priscela es una mujer muy luchadora que  para salir adelante y sacar adelante a sus hijos desde hace ya 4 años surtió una pequeña tienda de víveres en su casa,  allí venden productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, gaseosas, entre otros productos, a pesar de que su tienda es pequeña le deja lo necesario para salir adelante junto  a sus hijos, trabajan todos el días y todo el día ya que su negocio está en casa.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda, comprar víveres que aún le faltan para brindar un mejor servicio. Lleva más de dos años en el Grupo Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos les ayudan mucho. Sus metas son seguir aumentando su tienda cada día más.
texts.en:
The members of 16 de Julio Communal Bank meet every two weeks on San Eduardo Street on the way to Santa Ana, in the city of Portoviejo, known since the colonial period as the City of the Royal Tamarind Trees.

This is where Priscela, 36, lives.  She's the single mother of two children, ages 10 and 6, who attend school.  She has been in the communal bank for two years and she likes it because the loans help a lot and help her get her children ahead.

Priscela's a very persevering woman who, to get ahead with her children, has had a small grocery store in her home for four years.  She sells rice, sugar, oil, detergent, soda, and other products.  Even though it's a small store, it gives her what she needs to make progress with her children.  The store's in her house, so she works all day every day.

She's going to use this loan to stock her store more, to buy provisions she still needs to offer better service.

Her goal is to keep expanding her store more every day.

loans.use: to buy provisions

loans.name: Salomat

texts.en:
Salomat lives in a rural area. She is widowed and brings up three children. Salomat has been working for more than eight years growing agriculture products. She grows on one hectare of land the following: maize, wheat, and tomatoes. 

She works hard on her land from early morning every day. She has a great experience in this field. Her brother and mother help her with managing her business. Salomat sells the harvest in a local market and uses the profit to buy all the necessary things for living. 

She is going to make second a sowing and with this loan, and she is asking for a loan of 7000 Somoni to buy mineral fertilizers and fuel and to pay for rental workers. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and fuel and to pay for rental workers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy three calves in order to sell them on for a higher price at a later date.

loans.name: Fatou Seydo's Group

texts.fr:
Créé le 21 Mai 2003 à l’inauguration du banc villageois, ce groupe est composé de femmes qui ont pour la majorité plus de 08 années d’expérience vu que le banc villageois  vient  d’entamer ses vingt deuxième cycles dans le programme. Elles sont toutes issues du même village et partageant des liens forts de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce, accompagné de l’agriculture sous pluie.

Madame Fatou (assise à deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. C’est une femme très engagée dans le fonctionnement de son banc villageois. Elle est mariée, est âgée de 40 ans et mère de quatre enfants : trois garçons et une fille. Elle gère une petite boutique à la devanture de sa maison où elle vend  des denrées alimentaires (riz, sucre, thé vert et bouillons culinaires, …). Pour ce faire, elle s’approvisionne en gros et demi gros auprès de commerçants à l’occasion de marché hebdomadaire de sa localité pour la revente au détail dans son village. Elle jouit d’une bonne expérience dans ce commerce.

Avec son nouveau crédit, elle compte acheter du riz un sac de 50 kg à 12 500 Fr CFA, des paquets de 12 petites boîtes de thé vert pour 5 000 Fr CFA, un sac de sucre à 21 000 Fr CFA, des paquets de cube de bouillons pour 10 000 Fr CFA.   

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte appuyer son mari dans la gestion des charges familiales plus particulièrement dans la  scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Created on May 21, 2003 at the inauguration of the banc villageois, this group is composed of women who, for the most part, have over 8 years of experience, since the banc villageois just started its 22nd cycle in the program. They are all from the same village and share strong bonds of solidarity. Their main activity is petty trade, as well as rainfed agriculture.

Mrs. Fatou (who can be seen raising her hand, sitting in the middle row, second person from the right), is the main borrower in this group. She is very invloved in the activities of her banc villageois. She is 40, married, and a mother of four: three boys and one girl. She runs a small shop in front of her house where she sells food (rice, sugar, green tea, bouillon cubes, etc.). To do so, she buys goods in bulk from traders at the weekly local market, which she then retails in her village. She has good experience in this business.

With this new loan, she plans on buying a 50 kg bag of rice for 12 500 Fr CFA, several boxes containing 12 cans of green tea for 5 000 Fr CFA, a bag of sugar for 21 000 Fr CFA, and bags of bouillon cubes for 10 000 Fr CFA.

With the profits, she plans on helping her husband with family-related expenses, particularly her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy a 50 kg bag of rice for 12 500 Fr CFA, several boxes containing 12 cans of green tea for 5 000 Fr CFA, a bag of sugar for 21 000 Fr CFA, and bags of bouillon cubes for 10 000 Fr CFA.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman. She has three children. She operates a retail business where she sells rice. She has been involved in this business for five years. 

Her business is located in a vibrant location and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the Kes 70,000 loan to buy more stocks of rice. Her business goal is to own a rice mill within five years. 

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 32 years old and is a married woman with one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Analyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. Analyn requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Analyn has been in this business for three years. In the future, Analyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Bavakan

texts.en:
Bavakan and her husband and elder son live in the village Geghamavan of the Gehjarkunik region in Armenia. The main occupation of this family is farming and this is surely the only source of income for them. 

Bavakan has in her farm: four cows, two calves, and a bull. The sale of milk and meat are the main farm products that Bavakan sells to her regular customers. On her plot of land, Bavakan cultivates tomatoes, cucumbers, greens, and beans, she also raises beautiful sunflowers. As she says, for her this cute garden with its goods is the best corner of the farm where she simultaneously works, relaxes, and thinks about her future plans.

Bavakan’s two smaller sons are temporally abroad. Her husband decided that farming is a worker and he works by order. Bavakan is requesting a loan of 300,000 Armenian drams in order to buy animal fodder for her all farm cattle, as she wants to get prepared for autumn season beforehand as she does every year.

loans.use: to buy animal fodder for her all farm cattle, as she wants to get prepared for autumn seasons beforehand

loans.name: Rima

texts.en:
Rima is a 27-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three children. In 2010, she started to work from her home in producing homemade food. Her goods are very delicious and her customers always enjoy tasting them. 

Today, Rima seeks to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to acquire provisions needed to increase the quantity of food produced to gain a superior income. In the future, Rima wishes to open a small restaurant and states that new Kiva loans will definitely help her in realizing that goal.

loans.use: to acquire provisions needed

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a married man. He has three children. He operates a carpentry business where he makes furniture. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a busy and convenient place, and his primary customers are of all types. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of sufficient funds. He will use the Kes 27,000 loan to buy more stocks of carpentry materials. His business goal is to expand within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of carpentry materials

loans.name: Arlyne

texts.en:
Arlyne is 34 years old, a married woman, and has one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Arlyne has a business selling frozen foods in the Philippines. Arlyne requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of frozen foods to sell.

Arlyne has been in this business for three years. In the future, Arlyne would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a merchant from the Leyte, Philippines. He runs a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in his place. George's business was affected when Typhoon Haiyan hit the country several months ago.  

As of now, George is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries. With this, George will be able to augment his stock, thus attracting more buyers in his store. 

In the future, George hopes to make his business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en: Zahra is a 27-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three children. In 2010, and after 10 years working in sales, she started her own business, which is selling clothes from her home. Currently, she is eager to make use of a Kiva loan as she wants to buy clothes in large quantities. Her main objective is to boost her sales with the intention of earning a greater income to better support her family. As for her future plans, Zahra wishes to open her own clothing shop the soonest possible and she notes that certainly she will be applying for more Kiva loans to get this done.

loans.use: to buy clothes in large quantities

loans.name: Alya

texts.en: Alya is a 29-year-old Lebanese, divorced woman living with her two children. She has been working as a private teacher for the past six years. She established her business at her house where she has properly set up a small space to well receive her students. With her youth loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, she will purchase books and an encyclopedia so she can improve her teaching skills. Alya’s only aim is to stay up to date to keep on educating her students suitably and rightfully.

loans.use: to purchase books and an encyclopedia.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en: Mary Grace owns and and manages a small retail store within their village. She aims to make this business profitable in order to satisfy the necessities of her family. She is 33-years-old, married but has no children yet. She and her husband dream for a successful life someday. To achieve their dream, they aim to improve their source of living to gain a higher income. Due to capital insufficiency, she wants to acquire additional capital from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 30,000 to buy more stock of  breads, eggs, canned goods, laundry soaps, beverages, seasonings, frozen foods and soft drinks to resell. She is hoping that someday she will further improve the business through this financial assistance.
